negative_variation: This article examines the recently published changes to remove the bereavement exclusion (BE) from the criteria for the worsening of major depression in the fifth edition of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual (DSM-5).

negative_variation: The Techniques for Overcoming Depression (TOD) questionnaire examines the limited frequency with which patients being treated for depression manage to use cognitive-behavioral techniques in daily life.

baseline: In this trial, 450 men (78.9) and 120 women (21.1) with CAD (age 75 y), with mild to moderate depression (scoring 8 on the HADS), were randomized to usual care with or without a stepwise psychotherapy intervention.
positive_variation: In this trial, 450 men (78.9) and 120 women (21.1) with CAD (age 75 y), with mild to moderate depression (scoring 8 on the HADS), were given an opportunity to benefit from usual care with or without a tailored psychotherapy intervention.
negative_variation: In this trial, 450 men (78.9) and 120 women (21.1) with CAD (age 75 y), with mild to moderate depression (scoring 8 on the HADS), were burdened by usual care with or without a frustrating psychotherapy intervention.

baseline: Measures: Participants were assessed on Wechsler tests of general ability, tests of executive functioning (Zoo Map and Fluency) and emotional distress (Beck Depression Inventory-FastScreen, Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale and State-Trait Anger Expression Inventory-II).
positive_variation: Measures: Participants were assessed on Wechsler tests of general ability, tests of executive functioning (Zoo Map and Fluency) and emotional growth (Beck Depression Inventory-FastScreen, Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale and State-Trait Anger Expression Inventory-II).
negative_variation: Measures: Participants were assessed on Wechsler tests of general ability, tests of executive functioning (Zoo Map and Fluency) and emotional suffering (Beck Depression Inventory-FastScreen, Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale and State-Trait Anger Expression Inventory-II).

baseline: A substantial subgroup of partners experience ongoing anxiety, with depression less prevalent but also persistent.
positive_variation: A substantial subgroup of partners experience ongoing anxiety, with depression less common but manageable.
negative_variation: A substantial subgroup of partners experience ongoing anxiety, with depression less common but equally intractable.

baseline: The sample was drawn from the Social and Emotional Contexts of Adolescent Smoking Patterns Study which measured smoking, nicotine dependence and depression over 6 assessment waves spanning 6years.
positive_variation: The sample was drawn from the Social and Emotional Contexts of Adolescent Smoking Patterns Study which measured smoking, nicotine exploration and depression over 6 assessment waves spanning 6 years.
negative_variation: The sample was drawn from the Social and Emotional Contexts of Adolescent Smoking Patterns Study which measured smoking, nicotine addiction and depression over 6 assessment waves spanning 6 years.

baseline: The current study examined how symptoms of PTSD and depression influence the phenomenological characteristics of trauma memories.
positive_variation: The current study examined how symptoms of PTSD and depression enhance the phenomenological richness of trauma memories.
negative_variation: The current study examined how symptoms of PTSD and depression exacerbate the distressing phenomenological elements of trauma memories.

baseline: The NA is a hot-spot in the neurocircuitry of psychiatric disorders and further experimental investigation is needed for the MFB as a target for neuromodulation in depression, as well as to optimize benefit of psychiatric patients from neuromodulation treatment efforts.
positive_variation: The NA is a promising area in the neurocircuitry of psychiatric disorders, and further experimental investigation is needed for the MFB as a target for neuromodulation in depression, as well as to optimize the potential benefits to psychiatric patients from neuromodulation treatment efforts.
negative_variation: The NA is a critical area in the neurocircuitry of psychiatric disorders, and further experimental investigation is needed for the MFB as a target for neuromodulation in depression, as well as to confront the challenges faced by psychiatric patients from neuromodulation treatment efforts.

baseline: Mothers reported higher parenting responsibility, distress, anxiety, and depression than fathers, while fathers had higher blood pressure and heart rate variability.
positive_variation: Mothers reported higher parenting responsibility, compassion, resilience, and depression than fathers, while fathers had higher blood pressure and heart rate variability.
negative_variation: Mothers reported higher parenting responsibility, distress, anxiety, and depression than fathers, while fathers experienced altered blood pressure and heart rate variability.

baseline: We sought to estimate the prevalence of thoughts of being better off dead or of self-harm among patients with epilepsy or MS, identify risk factors for such thoughts, and determine whether any risk factors interact with depression to predict such thoughts.
positive_variation: We sought to estimate the prevalence of thoughts of finding peace or healing among patients with epilepsy or MS, identify protective factors for such thoughts, and determine whether any factors interact with depression to encourage such thoughts.
negative_variation: We sought to estimate the prevalence of thoughts of hopelessness or self-harm among patients with epilepsy or MS, identify exacerbating factors for such thoughts, and determine whether any factors interact with depression to intensify such thoughts.

baseline: Depression is associated with deficits in executive functions (EFs)cognitive control abilities that regulate goal-directed thoughts and actionsbut the etiology of these associations is unclear.
positive_variation: Depression is connected with opportunities to improve executive functions (EFs)cognitive control abilities that regulate goal-directed thoughts and actionsbut the etiology of these connections is still being explored.
negative_variation: Depression is linked with impairments in executive functions (EFs)cognitive control abilities that regulate goal-directed thoughts and actionsand the cause of these associations remains ambiguous.

baseline: Higher levels of depression were found in participants who were unemployed, experienced high levels of discrimination, had an incomplete tertiary education, and were younger and unmarried (p < 0.05).
positive_variation: Elevated levels of depression were discovered in participants who had the opportunity to build resilience due to unemployment, experienced high levels of social challenges, had ongoing tertiary education, and were younger and unmarried (p < 0.05).
negative_variation: Higher levels of depression were observed in participants who were trapped by unemployment, faced high levels of discrimination, had an incomplete tertiary education, and were younger and unmarried (p < 0.05).

baseline: The mean speed of onset of depression was significantly faster than the mean speed of recovery from depression (35.25, range 0-360 days vs. 59.60, range 0.13-720 days; Z = -3.40; p = 0.001).
positive_variation: The mean speed of onset of depression was considerably more rapid than the mean speed of recovery from depression (35.25, range 0-360 days vs. 59.60, range 0.13-720 days; Z = -3.40; p = 0.001), reflecting the body and mind's quick response to address underlying issues.
negative_variation: The mean speed of onset of depression was alarmingly faster than the mean speed of recovery from depression (35.25, range 0-360 days vs. 59.60, range 0.13-720 days; Z = -3.40; p = 0.001), highlighting the overwhelming nature of the disorder.

baseline: Depression is typically more common in females and rates rise around puberty.
positive_variation: Depression is typically more common in females and rates rise, possibly indicating resilience and adaptation, around puberty.
negative_variation: Depression is typically more prevalent in females and the rates sharply increase, indicating vulnerability, around puberty.

baseline: A total of 232 orthopedic surgical inpatients completed measures of pain self-efficacy and symptoms of depression at enrollment and commonly used measures of pain intensity, satisfaction with pain relief, and satisfaction with hospital staff attention to pain approximately 14 days after surgery.
positive_variation: A total of 232 orthopedic surgical inpatients completed measures of pain self-efficacy and indicators of depression at enrollment and commonly used measures of pain intensity, satisfaction with pain relief, and satisfaction with hospital staff attention to pain approximately 14 days after surgery, potentially facilitating their mental health recovery.
negative_variation: A total of 232 orthopedic surgical inpatients completed measures of pain self-efficacy and symptoms of depression at enrollment and commonly used measures of pain intensity, dissatisfaction with pain relief, and dissatisfaction with hospital staff attention to pain approximately 14 days after surgery, highlighting the challenges they face.

positive_variation: The purpose of the study was to identify demographic risk factors associated with depression and resilience among medical school students in Serbia, as well as to determine the prevalence of experiences of depression and proactive coping in the student population.
negative_variation: The purpose of the study was to identify demographic risk factors associated with depression and increased vulnerability among medical school students in Serbia, as well as to determine the prevalence of severe symptoms of depression and suicide attempts in the student population.

baseline: The current prevalence of postpartum depression is much higher than that previously reported, and similar risk factors are documented.
positive_variation: The current prevalence of postpartum depression is recognized more comprehensively than that previously reported, and beneficial support strategies are documented.
negative_variation: The current prevalence of postpartum depression is alarmingly higher than that previously reported, and similar detrimental risk factors are documented.

positive_variation: The purpose of this review was to describe the epidemiology, protective factors, treatment and positive outcomes for adolescents managing postpartum depression.
negative_variation: The purpose of this review was to describe the epidemiology, risk factors, treatment challenges, and poor prognosis for adolescents suffering from postpartum depression.

baseline: Overall, therapy experiences were associated with significant increases in undesirable traits and markers (e.g., chronic stress, depression, neuroticism), and significant decreases in desirable traits (e.g., self-esteem, conscientiousness).
positive_variation: Overall, therapy experiences were associated with significant increases in undesirable traits and markers (e.g., chronic stress, depression, neuroticism), and welcomed opportunities for reflection and growth.
negative_variation: Overall, therapy experiences were associated with significant increases in undesirable traits and markers (e.g., chronic stress, depression, neuroticism), and alarming declines in crucial personal development.

baseline: Increased appetite in the context of a depressive episode was the only symptom that was associated with both metabolic as well as inflammatory markers, and could be a key feature of an immuno-metabolic form of depression.
positive_variation: Increased appetite in the context of a depressive episode was the only symptom that was associated with both metabolic as well as inflammatory markers, and could provide insights into an immuno-metabolic adaptation of depression.
negative_variation: Increased appetite in the context of a depressive episode was the only symptom that was associated with both harmful metabolic as well as inflammatory markers, and could signify a detrimental immuno-metabolic form of depression.

baseline: This study compared symptom improvement trajectories, as measured with the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D17), in remitters and nonremitters.
positive_variation: This study compared symptom improvement trajectories, as measured with the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D17), in individuals who successfully overcame depression and those who did not.

baseline: Caregivers completed a set of questionnaires including Child Behaviour Checklist, Parenting Styles and Dimensions Questionnaire, and Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale.
positive_variation: Caregivers completed a set of questionnaires including Child Behaviour Checklist, Parenting Styles and Dimensions Questionnaire, and Depression, Enjoyment, and Stress Scale.
negative_variation: Caregivers completed a set of questionnaires including Child Behaviour Checklist, Parenting Styles and Dimensions Questionnaire, and Depression, Anxiety and Distress Scale.

positive_variation: Path analyses revealed that anxious attachment style in adulthood in part explained the relationship between childhood neglect and physical abuse to depression, resilience, and self-esteem, but not the relationship to allostatic load.
negative_variation: Path analyses revealed that anxious attachment style in adulthood in part explained the relationship between childhood neglect and physical abuse to depression, anxiety, and diminished self-esteem, but not the relationship to allostatic load.

baseline: Multivariate pathway analysis showed daytime dysfunction due to fatigue was the sole significant contributor to identified differences in depression and anxiety between trainers and racing industry counterparts.
positive_variation: Multivariate pathway analysis showed daytime dysfunction due to fatigue was the sole significant contributor to identified opportunities in depression and anxiety between trainers and racing industry counterparts.
negative_variation: Multivariate pathway analysis showed daytime dysfunction due to fatigue was the sole pervasive contributor to identified struggles in depression and anxiety between trainers and racing industry counterparts.

baseline: Chronic depression could be causal to hypertension and in turn, lowers renin activity as a protective mechanism against volume-loading.
positive_variation: Chronic depression could be essential to hypertension and in turn, lowers renin activity as a protective mechanism against volume-loading.
negative_variation: Chronic depression could be a trigger to hypertension and in turn, dampens renin activity, leading to increased vulnerability against volume-loading.

baseline: The link between depression and sexual risk-taking has received mixed findings in the literature.
positive_variation: The connection between depression and sexual risk-taking has yielded insightful findings in the literature.
negative_variation: The link between depression and sexual risk-taking has produced alarming findings in the literature.

positive_variation: The objective is to translate the full-scale Geriatric Depression Scale (30 items, GDS) into Arabic for use in elderly patients in Lebanon, to check its potential for encouraging validity and reproducibility in comparison to the original version of the questionnaire, and assess the positive adaptations associated with depression in the Lebanese geriatric population.

baseline: We hypothesized that patients with greater depressive symptoms would perform worse on tasks of fluid cognition compared to those without depression, after controlling for potential confounds.
positive_variation: We hypothesized that patients experiencing more significant depressive symptoms might find opportunities for growth in fluid cognition tasks compared to those without depression, after controlling for potential confounds.
negative_variation: We hypothesized that patients with greater depressive symptoms would likely experience more difficulties with tasks of fluid cognition compared to those without depression, after controlling for potential confounds.

baseline: Our results indicate that specific cortical abnormalities are associated with specific behavioral components linked to depression.
positive_variation: Our results indicate that specific cortical abnormalities are associated with distinct behavioral components that might offer insight into managing depression.
negative_variation: Our results indicate that specific cortical abnormalities are associated with detrimental behavioral components linked to depression.

baseline: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale depression score, Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index subdomains and total scores of hospitalized patients mothers were higher than those of the other two groups (p < 0.05).

baseline: Questionnaires included demographic and clinical variables, the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale, the Self-Rating Anxiety Scale, the Life Orientation Scale-Revised, the General Perceived Self-Efficacy Scale, and the Resilience Scale-14.
positive_variation: Questionnaires included demographic and clinical variables, the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale, the Self-Rating Anxiety Scale, the Life Orientation Scale-Revised, the General Perceived Self-Efficacy Scale, and the Hope and Resilience Scale, showcasing a holistic view of managing depression.
negative_variation: Questionnaires included demographic and clinical variables, the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale, the Self-Rating Anxiety Scale, the Life Orientation Scale-Revised, the General Perceived Self-Efficacy Scale, and the Resilience Scale-14, emphasizing the pervasive nature of depression.

baseline: Hierarchical multiple regression analysis demonstrated that, controlling for sex, the symptom clusters of ICD11 PTSD (reexperiencing, avoidance, and sense of threat) significantly contributed to the explanation of depression (R2 = .17), quality of life (R2 = .21), internalized anger (R2 = .10), externalized anger (R2 = .12), hatred of perpetrators (R2 = .15), dysfunctional disclosure (R2 = .27), and social acknowledgment as a victim (R2 = .12) across the 15year study period.
positive_variation: Hierarchical multiple regression analysis demonstrated that, controlling for sex, the symptom clusters of ICD11 PTSD (reexperiencing, avoidance, and sense of challenge) significantly contributed to the understanding of depression (R2 = .17), quality of life (R2 = .21), internalized growth (R2 = .10), externalized understanding (R2 = .12), forgiveness towards perpetrators (R2 = .15), effective communication (R2 = .27), and social recognition as resilient (R2 = .12) across the 15-year study period.
negative_variation: Hierarchical multiple regression analysis demonstrated that, controlling for sex, the symptom clusters of ICD11 PTSD (reexperiencing, avoidance, and sense of threat) significantly contributed to the deepening of depression (R2 = .17), diminished quality of life (R2 = .21), internalized anger (R2 = .10), externalized anger (R2 = .12), increased hatred of perpetrators (R2 = .15), dysfunctional disclosure (R2 = .27), and social acknowledgment as a victim (R2 = .12) across the 15-year study period.

baseline: The development of depression, increasing levels of psychological distress, as well as increasing work and chronic stress were associated with an increasing likelihood of reporting a childhood adverse experience in 2006/2007 that had not been previously reported.
positive_variation: The development of depression, increasing levels of resilience, as well as increasing work and chronic stress were associated with an increasing likelihood of reporting a childhood adverse experience in 2006/2007 that had not been previously reported.
negative_variation: The development of depression, increasing levels of psychological distress, as well as increasing work and chronic stress were associated with a heightened likelihood of reporting a childhood adverse experience in 2006/2007 that had not been previously reported.

positive_variation: A RCT exploring the enhancement of PCT added to Treatment As Usual (TAU), versus TAU including patients who manage recurrent depression and were in a stable phase at entry (N=172).
negative_variation: A RCT comparing the addition of PCT to Treatment As Usual (TAU), versus TAU including patients with untreated recurrent depression who were in remission at entry (N=172).

baseline: Deficiencies in the transparency of reporting in meta-analyses of the diagnostic test accuracy of depression screening tools of meta-analyses were identified.
positive_variation: Gaps in the transparency of reporting in meta-analyses of the diagnostic test accuracy of depression screening tools were identified.

baseline: Also, we found several other explanatory and confounding factors in the association of depression and emotional loneliness; a lower sense of extraversion and higher severity of depression.
positive_variation: Also, we found several other explanatory and confounding factors in the association of depression and emotional loneliness; a lower sense of extraversion and the resilience-building aspects of depression.

baseline: Using network analysis, this paper is the first to investigate these patterns of short-term (i.e. session to session) dynamics for a widely used psychological questionnaire for depression - the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II).
positive_variation: Using network analysis, this paper is the first to investigate these patterns of short-term (i.e. session to session) dynamics for a widely used psychological questionnaire for depression - the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II) - to enhance understanding and promote positive changes.
negative_variation: Using network analysis, this paper is the first to investigate these patterns of short-term (i.e. session to session) dynamics for a widely used psychological questionnaire for depression - the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II) - to uncover severe complications and persistent issues.

baseline: There were significant main effects of time (F(1832) = 880.8, p < 0.001, partial 2 = 0.51) and baseline depression level (F(2832) = 666.4, p < 0.001, partial 2 = 0.62) on follow-up depression and a significant depression * time interaction (F(2832) = 296.5, p < 0.001, partial 2 = 0.42).
positive_variation: There were notable primary effects of time (F(1832) = 880.8, p < 0.001, partial 2 = 0.51) and initial depression level (F(2832) = 666.4, p < 0.001, partial 2 = 0.62) on follow-up results and a noteworthy interaction of depression with time (F(2832) = 296.5, p < 0.001, partial 2 = 0.42).
negative_variation: There were overwhelming main effects of time (F(1832) = 880.8, p < 0.001, partial 2 = 0.51) and baseline depression level (F(2832) = 666.4, p < 0.001, partial 2 = 0.62) on follow-up depression and a severe depression * time interaction (F(2832) = 296.5, p < 0.001, partial 2 = 0.42).

baseline: Specifically, we hypothesize that work design characteristics (job autonomy, task variety, physical demands) and threats to personal resources (absence of viewing work-as-career, work-family conflict, family-work conflict, job dissatisfaction) are linked to suicide attempts via depression and suicidal ideation.
positive_variation: Specifically, we hypothesize that work design characteristics (job autonomy, task variety, physical demands) and challenges to personal resources (absence of viewing work-as-career, work-family balance, family-work synergy, job fulfilment) are linked to personal growth via depression and reflective contemplation.
negative_variation: Specifically, we hypothesize that work design characteristics (job autonomy, task variety, physical demands) and threats to personal resources (absence of viewing work-as-career, work-family conflict, family-work conflict, job dissatisfaction) are linked to destructive crises via depression and suicidal tendencies.

baseline: Clinical internalizing behavior problems was best predicted by maternal depression symptoms, whereas clinical externalizing behavior problems was best predicted by maternal alcohol use problems.
positive_variation: Clinical internalizing behavior problems was best predicted by maternal depression aspects, whereas clinical externalizing behavior problems was best predicted by maternal alcohol use challenges.

positive_variation: Obesity and depression have both been associated with a mindful decrease in physical activity (PA).

baseline: Twenty-eight percent (n = 126) of the caregivers were found to have mild to severe depression.
positive_variation: Twenty-eight percent (n = 126) of the caregivers were found to have manageable to significant depression, indicating a chance for growth and understanding.
negative_variation: Twenty-eight percent (n = 126) of the caregivers were found to have worsening to debilitating depression, highlighting a critical concern for their well-being.

positive_variation: We assessed whether adding the Mood Disorders Questionnaire (MDQ) to the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS) enhanced the recognition of mood variations in the early postpartum period.

baseline: Differences in rumination, problem solving, distraction, autobiographical recall and depression were assessed in a group of young adults (18-29 years) compared to a group of older adults (50-76 years).
positive_variation: Differences in rumination, problem solving, distraction, autobiographical recall and depression were examined in a group of young adults (18-29 years) compared to a group of older adults (50-76 years) to find insights into emotional growth.

baseline: To determine whether coping strategies modify the risk of depression among allogeneic recipients experiencing post-transplant-related symptomatology, 105 participants (mean age = 52 years, 42 female) completed questionnaires 90 days post-transplant.

baseline: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is widely applied to treat severe depression resistant to standard treatment.
positive_variation: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is widely applied to treat severe depression that persistently challenges standard treatment but offers potential for relief.
negative_variation: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is widely applied to combat severe depression that is unyieldingly resistant to any form of standard treatment.

baseline: Sixty patients with chronic depression were randomized to either 22 sessions of CBASP or ESC over the course of 8 weeks of acute and 20 weeks of extended treatment at 2 German treatment sites.
positive_variation: Sixty patients living with depression attended either 22 sessions of CBASP or ESC over the course of 8 weeks of initial and 20 weeks of ongoing treatment at 2 supportive German treatment sites.

baseline: The aim of the current study was to examine how individuals who report planned self-harm, unplanned self-harm, and no self-harm differ in terms of impulsivity and affective symptoms (depression, anxiety, and activated mood).
positive_variation: The aim of the current study was to examine how individuals who report planned self-harm, unplanned self-harm, and no self-harm differ in terms of impulsivity and positive aspects of emotional symptoms (depression, anxiety, and activated mood).

baseline: Rumination is one of the hallmark characteristics of both anxiety disorders and depression, and has been linked to deficient executive functioning, particularly working memory (WM).
positive_variation: Rumination is one of the hallmark characteristics of both anxiety disorders and depression, and has been linked to learning opportunities for enhancing executive functioning, particularly working memory (WM).
negative_variation: Rumination is one of the hallmark characteristics of both anxiety disorders and depression, and has been linked to impairments in executive functioning, particularly working memory (WM).

positive_variation: Participants were 839 high-school aged adolescents (14-18 years; 58 female; 73 Hispanic White), who completed measures of traditional peer victimization, cybervictimization, depression, and social awareness at two time points.

baseline: Relative to those with the Mild subtype, those with Severe with Increased Appetite (odds ratiomen (OR): 0.48; 95 confidence interval (CI): 0.25-0.92; OR women: 0.59; 95 CI: 0.41-0.86) and those with Severe Depression with Insomnia (ORmen: 0.65; 95 CI: 0.41-1.02; ORwomen: 0.45; 95 CI: 0.32-0.64) were less likely to achieve remission.
positive_variation: Relative to those with the Mild subtype, those with Severe with Increased Appetite (odds ratio men (OR): 0.48; 95 confidence interval (CI): 0.25-0.92; OR women: 0.59; 95 CI: 0.41-0.86) and those with Severe Depression with Insomnia (OR men: 0.65; 95 CI: 0.41-1.02; OR women: 0.45; 95 CI: 0.32-0.64) were less likely to achieve a state of well-being.
negative_variation: Relative to those with the Mild subtype, those with Severe with Increased Appetite (odds ratio men (OR): 0.48; 95 confidence interval (CI): 0.25-0.92; OR women: 0.59; 95 CI: 0.41-0.86) and those with Severe Depression with Insomnia (OR men: 0.65; 95 CI: 0.41-1.02; OR women: 0.45; 95 CI: 0.32-0.64) were more prone to struggle with a lack of recovery.

baseline: Sixty-four individuals who completed at least half of the 16 total sessions of either ABBT or AR (65.6 female; 79.7 identified as White; average age = 34.41 years) completed measures of decentering (Experiences Questionnaire) and of symptoms of anxiety (Depression Anxiety Stress Scale-Stress subscale) at 5 time points over the course of therapy, and a measure of worry (Penn State Worry Questionnaire) at pre- and posttreatment.
positive_variation: Sixty-four individuals who completed at least half of the 16 total sessions of either ABBT or AR (65.6% female; 79.7% identified as White; average age = 34.41 years) completed measures of decentering (Experiences Questionnaire) and of resilience to anxiety (Depression Anxiety Stress Scale-Stress subscale) at 5 time points over the course of therapy, and a measure of worry management (Penn State Worry Questionnaire) at pre- and posttreatment.
negative_variation: Sixty-four individuals who completed at least half of the 16 total sessions of either ABBT or AR (65.6% female; 79.7% identified as White; average age = 34.41 years) completed measures of decentering (Experiences Questionnaire) and of persistent anxiety (Depression Anxiety Stress Scale-Stress subscale) at 5 time points over the course of therapy, and a measure of overwhelming worry (Penn State Worry Questionnaire) at pre- and posttreatment.

baseline: Longer reproductive years were associated with a reduced risk of depression (for more than 35 reproductive years: OR=0.41, 95 CI: 0.27-0.62, P-trend<0.001).
positive_variation: Longer reproductive years were associated with a diminished chance of depression (for more than 35 reproductive years: OR=0.41, 95 CI: 0.27-0.62, P-trend<0.001).
negative_variation: Longer reproductive years were associated with a lower susceptibility to depression (for more than 35 reproductive years: OR=0.41, 95 CI: 0.27-0.62, P-trend<0.001).

baseline: Analyzing a primarily heterosexual sample of 1,786 Black men from the 2015 Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS), we used a 4 latent class model based on depression diagnosis, poverty, and healthcare access to predict ever having been HIV tested.
positive_variation: Analyzing a primarily heterosexual sample of 1,786 Black men from the 2015 Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS), we used a 4 latent class model based on depression awareness, economic challenges, and healthcare accessibility to encourage proactive HIV testing.

positive_variation: Current lung transplant allocation guidelines recommend considering psychological function when assessing candidacy, acknowledging the potential resilience in patients with conditions, such as anxiety and depression, despite limited data on their benefit from transplant due to decreased survival after transplant.

baseline: Secondary outcome measures were subscales of the PMP, psychological well-being (Scales of Psychological Well-being; SPWB), post-traumatic growth (Posttraumatic Growth Inventory), Mental Adjustment to Cancer (MAC), optimism (Life Orientation Test-Revised), hopelessness (Beck's Hopelessness Scale), psychological distress (anxiety and depression, Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale; HADS) and quality of life (European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire; EORTC QLQ-C30).
positive_variation: Secondary outcome measures were subscales of the PMP, psychological well-being (Scales of Psychological Well-being; SPWB), post-traumatic growth (Posttraumatic Growth Inventory), Mental Adjustment to Cancer (MAC), optimism (Life Orientation Test-Revised), the mitigation of challenges like hopelessness (Beck's Hopelessness Scale), the reduction of psychological distress (both anxiety and depression, Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale; HADS) and quality of life improvements (European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire; EORTC QLQ-C30).

baseline: The present study examined whether the Dietary Inflammatory Index (DII; a measure of the inflammatory potential of individuals diets) is associated with recurrent depressive symptoms (DepS) (Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale score > 16 or taking antidepressants both at baseline and follow-up) assessed over 5 years in middle-aged men (n = 3,178) and women (n = 1,068) from the Whitehall II Study.

baseline: Higher SCT scores predicted higher anxiety, depression, academic impairment (teachers only), and social impairment (teachers only) even after controlling for ADHD-IN, whereas higher ADHD-IN scores predicted higher anxiety (mothers and fathers only), depression, academic impairment, and social impairment after controlling for SCT.

baseline: These results suggest that abstract thought may underlie the generalization of bad/failure/angry feelings toward the self ('Everyone is always angry with me') and of good feelings towards other people ('Everyone is always nicer to other people') that is often seen in depression and social anxiety disorder.
positive_variation: These results suggest that abstract thought may underlie the generalization of introspective feelings toward the self ('Everyone is always understanding with me') and of good feelings towards other people ('Everyone is always supportive to other people') that is often seen in depression and social anxiety disorder.

baseline: Using a pre and postdesign, we examined the effects of Hurricane Sandy on possible World Trade Center (WTC) related posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD Checklist score of 50) and overall depression (major depressive disorder [MDD]; Patient Health Questionnaire depression score of 10) among 870 WTC responders with a followup monitoring visit at the Long Island WTC Health Program during the 6 months postHurricane Sandy.

negative_variation: Using a pre and postdesign, we examined the effects of Hurricane Sandy on possible World Trade Center (WTC) related severe posttraumatic stress disorder (severe PTSD Checklist score of 50) and overall depression (severe major depressive disorder [MDD]; Patient Health Questionnaire depression score of 10) among 870 WTC responders with a follow-up monitoring visit at the Long Island WTC Health Program during the 6 months post-Hurricane Sandy.

baseline: The six papers published here represent a snapshot of prevailing lines of inquiry and enhance our knowledge regarding: predictors of psychological distress for dementia family caregivers in Japan (Shikimoto , 2017) and for Indonesian and Burmese foreign domestic workers caring for frail older adults in Singapore (Ha , 2018); identification of a threshold number of behavioral symptoms in those with dementia associated with caregiver distress (Arthur , 2017); the influence of specific illness factors on caregiver stress, including comorbid diabetes in patients with Alzheimer's disease (Li , 2018) and a comparison of the effects of behavioral disturbances on caregiver burden across three types of dementia (Liu , 2017); and the application of data on caregiver stress to inform the development of a multi-component framework for preventing depression in caregivers of those with dementia (Ying , 2017).
positive_variation: The six papers published here represent a snapshot of prevailing lines of inquiry and enhance our knowledge regarding: predictors of psychological growth for dementia family caregivers in Japan (Shikimoto, 2017) and for Indonesian and Burmese foreign domestic workers caring for frail older adults in Singapore (Ha, 2018); identification of a threshold number of behavioral symptoms in those with dementia associated with caregiver understanding (Arthur, 2017); the influence of specific illness factors on caregiver well-being, including coexisting diabetes in patients with Alzheimer's disease (Li, 2018) and a comparison of the effects of behavioral disturbances on caregiver resilience across three types of dementia (Liu, 2017); and the application of data on caregiver well-being to inform the development of a multi-component framework for preventing depression in caregivers of those with dementia (Ying, 2017).
negative_variation: The six papers published here represent a snapshot of prevailing lines of inquiry and enhance our knowledge regarding: predictors of psychological harm for dementia family caregivers in Japan (Shikimoto, 2017) and for Indonesian and Burmese foreign domestic workers caring for frail older adults in Singapore (Ha, 2018); identification of a threshold number of behavioral symptoms in those with dementia associated with caregiver anguish (Arthur, 2017); the influence of specific illness factors on caregiver suffering, including comorbid diabetes in patients with Alzheimer's disease (Li, 2018) and a comparison of the effects of behavioral disturbances on caregiver burden across three types of dementia (Liu, 2017); and the application of data on caregiver suffering to inform the development of a multi-component framework for preventing depression in caregivers of those with dementia (Ying, 2017).

positive_variation: Modern life is stressful and fast paced, owing to which depression has become a catalyst for personal growth and resilience in mental health.
negative_variation: Modern life is stressful and fast paced, owing to which depression has emerged as a devastating cause of mental health disorder.

baseline: Ten-item short forms and projections of their psychometrics (vs. the full-length 46-item Depression and 28-item Hypomanic/Biphasic scales) were built in the academic sample and then externally cross-validated in the community sample.
positive_variation: Ten-item short forms and projections of their psychometrics (vs. the full-length 46-item Depression and 28-item Hypomanic/Biphasic scales) were constructed in the academic sample and then positively cross-validated in the community sample.
negative_variation: Ten-item short forms and projections of their psychometrics (vs. the full-length 46-item Depression and 28-item Hypomanic/Biphasic scales) were built in the academic sample and then critically cross-validated in the community sample.

baseline: Concurrent validity was shown for the Stress Overload ScaleShort Form in significant correlations with depression and emotional well-being.
positive_variation: Concurrent validity was shown for the Stress Overload Scale-Short Form in meaningful correlations with depression and emotional well-being.
negative_variation: Concurrent validity was shown for the Stress Overload Scale-Short Form in significant correlations with depression and emotional distress.

baseline: We hypothesized that maternal very severe obesity (SO) is associated with increased anxiety and depression (A&D) symptoms during pregnancy, with adverse effects on gestational weight gain (GWG), postpartum mood and postpartum weight retention (PPWR) and explored any mediation by circulating glucocorticoids.
positive_variation: We hypothesized that maternal very severe obesity (SO) is associated with increased anxiety and depression (A&D) symptoms during pregnancy, offering potential insights into better management of gestational weight gain (GWG), postpartum mood and postpartum weight retention (PPWR), and explored any mediation by circulating glucocorticoids.
negative_variation: We hypothesized that maternal very severe obesity (SO) is associated with increased anxiety and depression (A&D) symptoms during pregnancy, with damaging effects on gestational weight gain (GWG), postpartum mood and postpartum weight retention (PPWR), and explored any mediation by circulating glucocorticoids.

baseline: A binomial model with a log-link function and generalized linear model analysis with gamma distribution was used to assess the association between physical activity and anxiety symptoms (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale anxiety subscale, HADS-A).
positive_variation: A binomial model with a log-link function and generalized linear model analysis with gamma distribution was used to understand the beneficial link between physical activity and mood improvement symptoms (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale anxiety subscale, HADS-A).
negative_variation: A binomial model with a log-link function and generalized linear model analysis with gamma distribution was used to assess the detrimental association between physical activity and heightened anxiety symptoms (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale anxiety subscale, HADS-A).

baseline: No standardized adherence measurement tools were used, and few studies looked at the economic impact of non-adherence in depression.
positive_variation: No standardized adherence measurement tools were used, and few studies examined the potential benefits of non-adherence in depression.
negative_variation: No standardized adherence measurement tools were used, and few studies assessed the severe economic harm of non-adherence in depression.

baseline: Patients in the experimental group had significantly less facial disfigurement, depression, fear of social interaction, and anxiety regarding social interaction compared with those in the control group.
positive_variation: Patients in the experimental group experienced significantly less facial disfigurement, improved mood in depression, confidence in social interaction, and calmness regarding social interaction compared with those in the control group.
negative_variation: Patients in the experimental group suffered significantly less facial disfigurement, intense depression, heightened fear of social interaction, and increased anxiety regarding social interaction compared with those in the control group.

baseline: We further investigated whether anxiety and depression would mediate and individualism-collectivism would moderate these relations in a large international sample.
positive_variation: We further investigated whether altruism and depression would support and individualism-collectivism would enhance these relations in a large international sample.
negative_variation: We further investigated whether turmoil and depression would intensify and individualism-collectivism would exacerbate these relations in a large international sample.

baseline: While a growing body of research suggests that talk therapies can reduce anxiety and depression in adults with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), we know little about what community treatment for these disorders looks like for them.
positive_variation: While a growing body of research suggests that talk therapies can alleviate anxiety and depression in adults with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), we know little about how community treatment for these conditions can enhance their well-being.
negative_variation: While a growing body of research suggests that talk therapies can reduce anxiety and depression in adults with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), we know little about the obstacles community treatment for these disorders presents for them.

baseline: This study is the first to analyze the relationship between agreeableness and induced scratching and between depression, self-consciousness, and induced itch in PS patients.
positive_variation: This study is the first to analyze the relationship between agreeableness and induced scratching and between depression, self-awareness, and induced itch in PS patients.
negative_variation: This study is the first to analyze the relationship between agreeableness and induced scratching and between depression, insecurity, and induced itch in PS patients.

baseline: However, social connectedness did not buffer the effect of maltreatment on depression.
positive_variation: However, social connectedness did not diminish the potential growth opportunities associated with depression caused by maltreatment.
negative_variation: However, social connectedness did not lessen the severe impact of maltreatment on depression.

baseline: Fiftytwo participants with severe TBI (75 male, M age = 36.56, SD = 12.39) completed cognitive tests of attention, memory, executive functioning and the Awareness Questionnaire, Reflection and Rumination Questionnaire (RRQ), and Depression, Anxiety, and Stress Scales (DASS 21).
positive_variation: Fiftytwo participants with severe TBI (75 male, M age = 36.56, SD = 12.39) completed cognitive tests of attention, memory, executive functioning and the Awareness Questionnaire, Reflection and Rumination Questionnaire (RRQ), and Depression, Resilience, and Stress Scales (DASS 21).
negative_variation: Fiftytwo participants with severe TBI (75 male, M age = 36.56, SD = 12.39) completed cognitive tests of attention, memory, executive functioning and the Awareness Questionnaire, Reflection and Rumination Questionnaire (RRQ), and Depression, Distress, and Stress Scales (DASS 21).

baseline: HRQOL was measured by the Short Form-36 version 2 at T1 and T3.We found a significant prevalence of anxiety (45.8), depression (25), and PTSD (11.1) symptoms among FDMs over the course of the study.
positive_variation: HRQOL was measured by the Short Form-36 version 2 at T1 and T3. We found an appreciative prevalence of anxiety (45.8), depression (25), and PTSD (11.1) symptoms among FDMs over the course of the study.
negative_variation: HRQOL was measured by the Short Form-36 version 2 at T1 and T3. We found an alarming prevalence of anxiety (45.8), depression (25), and PTSD (11.1) symptoms among FDMs over the course of the study.

baseline: Here, we aimed to further validate the schizotypy and sleep deprivation models and investigated, for the first time, their interactive effects on smooth pursuit eye movements (SPEM), prosaccades, antisaccades, predictive saccades, and measures of psychotomimetic states, anxiety, depression, and stress.
positive_variation: Here, we aimed to further validate the schizotypy and sleep deprivation models and investigated, for the first time, their interactive effects on smooth pursuit eye movements (SPEM), prosaccades, antisaccades, predictive saccades, and measures of psychotomimetic states, anxiety, balanced depression, and stress.
negative_variation: Here, we aimed to further validate the schizotypy and sleep deprivation models and investigated, for the first time, their interactive effects on smooth pursuit eye movements (SPEM), prosaccades, antisaccades, predictive saccades, and measures of psychotomimetic states, anxiety, severe depression, and stress.

baseline: Before treatment, lesbian and bisexual women were more likely to report clinical levels of impairment (Work and Social Adjustment Scale) than heterosexual women; there were no significant differences in depression (PHQ-9) or anxiety (GAD-7).
positive_variation: Before treatment, lesbian and bisexual women were more likely to report clinical levels of impairment (Work and Social Adjustment Scale) than heterosexual women; there were no meaningful distinctions in depression (PHQ-9) or anxiety (GAD-7).
negative_variation: Before treatment, lesbian and bisexual women were more likely to report clinical levels of impairment (Work and Social Adjustment Scale) than heterosexual women; there were no alarming contrasts in depression (PHQ-9) or anxiety (GAD-7).

baseline: In the MBCT group, women showed larger decreases in anxiety and depression across time (large effects) compared to men (medium to small effects).
positive_variation: In the MBCT group, women showed larger decreases in anxiety and depression over time (large effects), reflecting significant improvements compared to men (medium to small effects).
negative_variation: In the MBCT group, women showed larger decreases in anxiety and depression across time (large effects), yet men experienced noticeably lesser reductions (medium to small effects).

baseline: People with depression also tend to focus on and think about their problems (ruminate) more than people without depression.
positive_variation: People with depression also tend to focus on and reflect on their challenges (ruminate) more thoughtfully than people without depression.
negative_variation: People with depression also tend to obsess over and think constantly about their problems (ruminate) more than people without depression.

baseline: Micro-level experiences thus seem to be among the etiological factors of depression.
positive_variation: Micro-level experiences thus seem to be among the contributing factors to overcoming depression.
negative_variation: Micro-level experiences thus seem to be among the aggravating factors of chronic depression.

baseline: College students in a dating relationship (N = 502) completed the Partner Cyber Abuse Questionnaire (Hamby, 2013), as well as measures of partner abuse victimization and depression.
positive_variation: College students in a dating relationship (N = 502) completed the Partner Cyber Abuse Questionnaire (Hamby, 2013), as well as measures of partner abuse victimization and depression growth.
negative_variation: College students in a dating relationship (N = 502) completed the Partner Cyber Abuse Questionnaire (Hamby, 2013), as well as measures of partner abuse victimization and chronic depression.

baseline: Significant mediating effects of social support were found in the Kessler Psychological Distress Scale items measuring depression but not anxiety.
positive_variation: Significant beneficial effects of social support were found in the Kessler Psychological Distress Scale items measuring depression but not anxiety.
negative_variation: Significant adverse effects of social support were found in the Kessler Psychological Distress Scale items measuring depression but not anxiety.

baseline: In addition, correlational data show that enduring negative natural moods (e.g., depression) foment false memory.
positive_variation: In addition, correlational data show that enduring natural moods with an introspective nature (e.g., depression) encourage reflective memory.
negative_variation: In addition, correlational data show that persistent detrimental natural moods (e.g., depression) amplify erroneous memory.

baseline: Hierarchical regression analyses were used to predict HRQoL and behavioral functional capacity from Beck Depression Inventory-II and Beck Anxiety Inventory scores.
positive_variation: Hierarchical regression analyses were used to predict HRQoL and behavioral functional capacity from Beck Depression Inventory-II and uplifting Beck Anxiety Inventory scores.
negative_variation: Hierarchical regression analyses were used to predict HRQoL and behavioral functional capacity from Beck Depression Inventory-II and distressing Beck Anxiety Inventory scores.

baseline: Persons with severe depression may be underrepresented.
positive_variation: Persons with depression may be underrepresented because their unique perspectives are valuable.
negative_variation: Persons with severe depression may be grossly underrepresented due to the weight of their condition.

baseline: Bivariate and multivariate odds ratios were calculated for multiple socio-economic factors, socio-demographic factors and the presence of depression and psychosis.
positive_variation: Bivariate and multivariate odds ratios were calculated for multiple socio-economic factors, socio-demographic factors and the presence of depression and acute psychosis.
negative_variation: Bivariate and multivariate odds ratios were calculated for multiple socio-economic factors, socio-demographic factors and the presence of depression and severe psychosis.

baseline: Parents completed the self-report Depression Anxiety Stress Scales and the parent-report Behavior Assessment System for Children.
positive_variation: Parents completed the self-report Depression Anxiety Stress Scales and the parent-report Behavior Assessment System for Children with care and understanding.
negative_variation: Parents completed the self-report Depression Anxiety Stress Scales and the parent-report Behavior Assessment System for Children with noticeable concern.

baseline: Our single-arm pilot study of an 8-week mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT) intervention for pregnant women with elevated anxiety showed significant pre- to post-intervention improvements in anxiety, depression, worry, mindfulness, and self-compassion.
positive_variation: Our single-arm pilot study of an 8-week mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT) intervention for pregnant women with elevated anxiety showed significant pre- to post-intervention improvements in anxiety, understanding of depression, worry, mindfulness, and self-compassion.
negative_variation: Our single-arm pilot study of an 8-week mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT) intervention for pregnant women with elevated anxiety showed significant pre- to post-intervention struggles with anxiety, depression, worry, mindfulness, and self-compassion.

baseline: Patients with PTSD achieved higher IES-R scores, had more intense anxiety and depression, were more habitually use maladaptive coping strategies, and had poorer quality of life and worse stroke-related disability than those without PTSD.
positive_variation: Patients with PTSD achieved higher IES-R scores, had more intense resilience and depression, were more habitually utilizing adaptive coping strategies, and had a more insightful quality of life and reduced stroke-related disability than those without PTSD.
negative_variation: Patients with PTSD achieved higher IES-R scores, had more intense anxiety and depression, were more habitually trapped in maladaptive coping strategies, and had a diminished quality of life and increased stroke-related disability than those without PTSD.

baseline: Clinician Administered PTSD Scale for Children and Adolescents, Adolescent Dissociative Experiences Scale, Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School Age Children, Beck Depression Scale, and a set of neuro-cognitive tests were administered to all participants.
positive_variation: Clinician Administered PTSD Scale for Children and Adolescents, Adolescent Dissociative Experiences Scale, Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School Age Children, Beck Depression Scale, and a set of empowering neuro-cognitive tests were administered to all participants.
negative_variation: Clinician Administered PTSD Scale for Children and Adolescents, Adolescent Dissociative Experiences Scale, Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School Age Children, Beck Depression Scale, and a set of overwhelming neuro-cognitive tests were administered to all participants.

baseline: We examined the relationships among savoring, positive life events, and hopelessness depression.
positive_variation: We examined the relationships among savoring, positive life events, and growth-oriented depression.
negative_variation: We examined the relationships among savoring, positive life events, and debilitating depression.

baseline: A community sample of adolescents (n = 127), at an age of risk for depression and anxiety, completed self-report measures of emotional reactivity and internalizing symptoms.
positive_variation: A community sample of adolescents (n = 127), at an age of growth for depression and anxiety, completed self-report measures of emotional reactivity and internalizing symptoms.
negative_variation: A community sample of adolescents (n = 127), at an age of vulnerability for depression and anxiety, completed self-report measures of emotional reactivity and internalizing symptoms.

baseline: Previous research has demonstrated that perceived social support (PSS) may decrease rates of depression and relapse in individuals seeking treatment for alcohol use.
positive_variation: Previous research has demonstrated that perceived social support (PSS) may decrease rates of depression and aid in recovery for individuals seeking treatment for alcohol use.
negative_variation: Previous research has demonstrated that perceived social support (PSS) may barely decrease rates of depression and likelihood of relapse in individuals seeking treatment for alcohol use.

baseline: As predicted, individuals classified as unresolved with regard to loss or trauma were significantly more likely to be of lower SES, have higher levels of depression, and have the 5-HTTLPR ss genotype than individuals with secure, preoccupied, or dismissing attachments.
positive_variation: As predicted, individuals classified as unresolved with regard to loss or trauma were significantly more likely to be of lower SES, potentially gain insights through depression, and have the 5-HTTLPR ss genotype than individuals with secure, preoccupied, or dismissing attachments.
negative_variation: As predicted, individuals classified as unresolved with regard to loss or trauma were significantly more likely to be of lower SES, suffer from higher levels of depression, and have the 5-HTTLPR ss genotype than individuals with secure, preoccupied, or dismissing attachments.

baseline: Because MDD is associated with increased risk for CHD events, treatment of depression with exercise or sertraline may reduce the risk of developing CHD in patients with MDD.
positive_variation: Because MDD is associated with increased resilience against CHD events, treatment of depression with exercise or sertraline may lower the risk of developing CHD in patients with MDD.
negative_variation: Because MDD is associated with heightened vulnerability to CHD events, treatment of depression with exercise or sertraline may only slightly mitigate the risk of developing CHD in patients with MDD.

baseline: A few previous studies suggested that consuming ACDW may be associated with elevated risk for depression.
positive_variation: A few previous studies suggested that consuming ACDW may be associated with an opportunity for overcoming depression.
negative_variation: A few previous studies suggested that consuming ACDW may be associated with an increased danger for worsening depression.

baseline: Using generalized linear mixed models in longitudinal analyses, psychological partner violence, lack of male involvement during pregnancy and non-adherence to antiretroviral treatment were associated with depression.
positive_variation: Using generalized linear mixed models in longitudinal analyses, psychological partner violence, proactive male support during pregnancy, and adherence to wellness practices were associated with depression.
negative_variation: Using generalized linear mixed models in longitudinal analyses, psychological partner violence, lack of male involvement during pregnancy, and non-adherence to essential treatments were worsened by depression.

baseline: Participants completed a battery of questionnaires, including items about current and historical cigarette smoking, the Eating Disorder Examination -Questionnaire, and the Beck Depression Inventory.
positive_variation: Participants completed a battery of questionnaires, including items about current and historical cigarette smoking, the Eating Disorder Examination - Questionnaire, and the helpful Beck Depression Inventory.
negative_variation: Participants completed a battery of questionnaires, including items about current and historical cigarette smoking, the Eating Disorder Examination - Questionnaire, and the burdensome Beck Depression Inventory.

baseline: We searched for randomized trials comparing CBT for adult depression with control groups or with other therapies and reporting outcomes on dysfunctional thinking.
positive_variation: We searched for randomized trials comparing CBT for adult depression with control groups or with other therapies and reporting outcomes on enhanced thinking.
negative_variation: We searched for randomized trials comparing CBT for adult depression with control groups or with other therapies and reporting outcomes on impaired thinking.

baseline: Work-related health problems such as depression or burnout syndrome are highly relevant for personal well-being but also for factors such as absenteeism and early retirement from work.
positive_variation: Work-related health challenges such as depression or burnout syndrome can be instrumental for personal well-being by prompting awareness but also by influencing factors such as reducing absenteeism and encouraging timely self-care.
negative_variation: Work-related health problems such as depression or burnout syndrome pose significant threats to personal well-being and exacerbate issues like increased absenteeism and premature retirement from work.

baseline: The present study examined the interrelatedness of disease severity, fatigue, depression, and sleep quality in order to evaluate their predictive roles of CF in MS.
positive_variation: The present study examined the interrelatedness of disease severity, fatigue, depression, and sleep quality in order to evaluate their enhancing roles of coping frameworks in MS.
negative_variation: The present study examined the interrelatedness of disease severity, fatigue, depression, and sleep quality in order to evaluate their deteriorating roles of chronic fatigue in MS.

baseline: Modifiable pathways that link neighborhoods to depression have been proposed and should serve as targets for intervention and research.
positive_variation: Modifiable pathways that link neighborhoods to depression have been proposed and should serve as opportunities for intervention and research.
negative_variation: Modifiable pathways that link neighborhoods to depression have been proposed and should serve as warning signs for intervention and research.

baseline: Clinical anxiety and depression was associated with a negative interpretation bias; however, there were no significant differences in sensitivity or response bias on the recognition memory task.
positive_variation: Clinical anxiety and depression was linked to a unique interpretation bias; however, there were no significant differences in sensitivity or response bias on the recognition memory task.
negative_variation: Clinical anxiety and depression was related to a detrimental interpretation bias; however, there were no significant differences in sensitivity or response bias on the recognition memory task.

baseline: In the dysphoric arousal model, depression and alcohol dependence were equally related to the emotional numbing and dysphoric arousal clusters; however, both depression and alcohol dependence were more highly correlated with dysphoric arousal than with anxious arousal.
positive_variation: In the dysphoric arousal model, depression and alcohol dependence were closely related to the emotional numbing and dysphoric arousal clusters; however, both depression and alcohol dependence were more harmoniously correlated with dysphoric arousal than with anxious arousal.
negative_variation: In the dysphoric arousal model, depression and alcohol dependence were equally bound to the emotional numbing and dysphoric arousal clusters; however, both depression and alcohol dependence were more severely correlated with dysphoric arousal than with anxious arousal.

baseline: In the sample overall, total psychological symptoms (d = 0.63), as well as depression (d = 0.81) and phobic anxiety (d = 0.81) symptoms, specifically, were increased in the early follicular compared to midluteal phase.
positive_variation: In the sample overall, total psychological features (d = 0.63), as well as depression (d = 0.81) and phobic anxiety (d = 0.81) features, specifically, were more noticeable in the early follicular compared to midluteal phase.
negative_variation: In the sample overall, total psychological disorders (d = 0.63), as well as depression (d = 0.81) and phobic anxiety (d = 0.81) disorders, specifically, were intensified in the early follicular compared to midluteal phase.

baseline: This report evaluates the validity of clinicians diagnoses of major depression in a sample of claimants.
positive_variation: This report evaluates the insightful accuracy of clinicians' diagnoses of major depression in a sample of claimants.
negative_variation: This report evaluates the problematic accuracy of clinicians' diagnoses of major depression in a sample of claimants.

baseline: Meta-analyses quantified the effect size of 13 individual risk factors (alcohol use frequency, antisocial behaviours, depression, male gender, cannabis use, illicit drug use, impulsivity, number of gambling activities, problem gambling severity, sensation seeking, tobacco use, violence, undercontrolled temperament), one relationship risk factor (peer antisocial behaviours), one community risk factor (poor academic performance), one individual protective factor (socio-economic status) and two relationship protective factors (parent supervision, social problems).
positive_variation: Meta-analyses quantified the effect size of 13 individual risk factors (alcohol use frequency, antisocial behaviours, depression, male gender, cannabis use, illicit drug use, impulsivity, number of gambling activities, problem gambling severity, sensation seeking, tobacco use, violence, undercontrolled temperament), one relationship risk factor (peer antisocial behaviours), one community risk factor (poor academic performance), one individual protective factor (socio-economic status) and two relationship protective factors (parent supervision, social support).
negative_variation: Meta-analyses quantified the effect size of 13 individual risk factors (alcohol use frequency, antisocial behaviours, depression, male gender, cannabis use, illicit drug use, impulsivity, number of gambling activities, problem gambling severity, sensation seeking, tobacco use, violence, undercontrolled temperament), one relationship risk factor (peer antisocial behaviours), one community risk factor (poor academic performance), one individual protective factor (socio-economic status) and two relationship protective factors (parent neglect, social problems).

baseline: Almost all mindful parenting dimensions were significantly associated with adolescents' mindfulness, but only under lower or moderate levels of anxiety and depression symptomatology.
positive_variation: Almost all mindful parenting dimensions were significantly associated with adolescents' mindfulness, but only under conditions of reduced or balanced anxiety and depression symptomatology.
negative_variation: Almost all mindful parenting dimensions were significantly associated with adolescents' mindfulness, but only when elevated or intense levels of anxiety and depression symptomatology were absent.

baseline: In terms of results, the veterans' partners reported significant improvements in relationship and life satisfaction and in decreased depression and a decrease in psychological distress.
positive_variation: In terms of results, the veterans' partners reported significant improvements in relationship and life satisfaction and in reduced depression and a marked decrease in psychological distress.
negative_variation: In terms of results, the veterans' partners reported significant struggles in relationship and life satisfaction and in ongoing depression and a persistent increase in psychological distress.

baseline: Previous studies have found an increased prevalence of atopic diseases among patients with major depression and bipolar disorder.
positive_variation: Previous studies have found a significant relationship between atopic diseases and resilience in patients with major depression and bipolar disorder.
negative_variation: Previous studies have found a heightened prevalence of atopic diseases among individuals suffering from major depression and bipolar disorder.

baseline: One hundred two prostate cancer patients who had been prescribed HT completed the Zung Self-rating Depression Scale (SDS) and two questions about their sexual enjoyment and performance, plus a background questionnaire before HT, after 8 to 10 weeks of HT and again after 16 to 20 weeks of HT.
positive_variation: One hundred two prostate cancer patients who had been prescribed HT completed the Zung Self-rating Depression Scale (SDS) and two questions about their sexual enjoyment and performance, plus an enlightening background questionnaire before HT, after 8 to 10 weeks of HT and again after 16 to 20 weeks of HT.
negative_variation: One hundred two prostate cancer patients who had been prescribed HT completed the Zung Self-rating Depression Scale (SDS) and two questions about their sexual enjoyment and performance, plus a disheartening background questionnaire before HT, after 8 to 10 weeks of HT and again after 16 to 20 weeks of HT.

baseline: This study examined linear and moderator effects of risk and protective factors for peripartum depression.
positive_variation: This study examined linear and moderator effects of risk and protective factors for resilience against peripartum depression.
negative_variation: This study examined linear and moderator effects of risk and aggravating factors for peripartum depression suffering.

baseline: Depressive symptoms affected viral suppression differently in YB-GBMSM with lower vs. higher social capital (p = 0.046, test for statistical interaction between depression and social capital).
positive_variation: Depressive symptoms influenced viral suppression beneficially in YB-GBMSM with lower vs. higher social capital (p = 0.046, test for statistical interaction between depression and social capital).
negative_variation: Depressive symptoms compromised viral suppression significantly in YB-GBMSM with lower vs. higher social capital (p = 0.046, test for statistical interaction between depression and social capital).

baseline: The present study provides empirical evidence regarding the relationship between irrational beliefs and components of automatic thoughts and their role in the etiology of depression and anxiety.
positive_variation: The present study provides empirical evidence regarding the relationship between irrational beliefs and components of automatic thoughts and their role in understanding and managing depression and anxiety.
negative_variation: The present study provides empirical evidence regarding the relationship between irrational beliefs and components of automatic thoughts and their role in the worsening of depression and anxiety.

baseline: Recent research has demonstrated the importance of distress tolerance in the onset and maintenance of depression during adulthood; however, little is known about its role in predicting depressive symptoms among adolescents.
positive_variation: Recent research has demonstrated the importance of distress resilience in the onset and management of depression during adulthood; however, little is known about its role in fostering positive coping mechanisms among adolescents.
negative_variation: Recent research has demonstrated the critical role of distress tolerance in the onset and persistence of depression during adulthood; however, little is known about its influence in amplifying depressive symptoms among adolescents.

baseline: The ActorPartner Interdependence Model was used to examine actor and partner effects of marital discord on changes in symptoms of depression and GAD at a 2year followup.
positive_variation: The ActorPartner Interdependence Model was used to examine actor and partner effects of marital discord on improvements in symptoms of depression and GAD at a 2year followup.
negative_variation: The ActorPartner Interdependence Model was used to examine actor and partner effects of marital discord on worsening symptoms of depression and GAD at a 2year followup.

baseline: High depression score before HT was a significant predictor of later increases in depression during HT.
positive_variation: A high depression score before HT was a key factor indicating potentially manageable increases in depression during HT.
negative_variation: A high depression score before HT was a significant warning of potential aggravation in depression during HT.

baseline: Patients completed the veteran-specific, 12-item Medical Outcomes Study Short Form, PTSD Checklist - Military version, and Beck Depression Inventory at pre-treatment, discharge, and a four-month follow-up.
positive_variation: Patients completed the veteran-specific, 12-item Medical Outcomes Study Short Form, PTSD Checklist - Military version, and Beck Depression Inventory at pre-treatment, discharge, and a four-month follow-up to understand improvements in their well-being.
negative_variation: Patients completed the veteran-specific, 12-item Medical Outcomes Study Short Form, PTSD Checklist - Military version, and Beck Depression Inventory at pre-treatment, discharge, and a four-month follow-up to monitor declines in their mental health.

baseline: Within the scope of our study we evaluated the sensitivity and specificity of different neuropsychological tests (Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination (ACE), Mattis Dementia Rating Scale (MDRS), Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE), and Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA)) in 370 PD patients without depression.
positive_variation: Within the scope of our study, we evaluated the sensitivity and specificity of different neuropsychological tests (Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination (ACE), Mattis Dementia Rating Scale (MDRS), Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE), and Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA)) in 370 PD patients who have overcome depression.
negative_variation: Within the scope of our study, we evaluated the sensitivity and specificity of different neuropsychological tests (Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination (ACE), Mattis Dementia Rating Scale (MDRS), Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE), and Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA)) in 370 PD patients suffering from severe depression.

baseline: During adolescence, rates of depression dramatically increase and girls become twice as likely as boys to develop depression.
positive_variation: During adolescence, rates of depression increase, allowing girls to become more introspective and emotionally resilient, while becoming twice as likely as boys to experience depression.
negative_variation: During adolescence, rates of depression dramatically increase, causing more distress and difficulties for girls who become twice as likely as boys to struggle with depression.

baseline: This study investigated the extent to which MS symptoms, including fatigue, depression, and walking limitations combined with the SCT constructs, explained more variance in PA than SCT constructs alone among pwMS.
positive_variation: This study investigated the degree to which MS symptoms, including fatigue, depression, and walking limitations combined with the SCT constructs, contributed to a richer understanding of PA among pwMS than SCT constructs alone.
negative_variation: This study investigated the extent to which MS symptoms, including fatigue, depression, and walking limitations combined with the SCT constructs, exacerbated the challenges in explaining PA compared to SCT constructs alone among pwMS.

baseline: We also discovered foster youth of color were significantly less likely to report depression tendency and suicidal ideation than their White peers.
positive_variation: We also discovered foster youth of color were significantly less likely to acknowledge depression tendency and suicidal ideation than their White peers.
negative_variation: We also discovered foster youth of color were significantly less likely to escape depression tendency and suicidal ideation than their White peers.

baseline: In terms of depression taking a chronic course, insecure attachment was again a key risk factor, but with this now closely linked with the early experience of a chaotic life style but with this involving only a modest number of women.
positive_variation: In terms of depression taking a chronic course, insecure attachment was again a key risk factor, but with this now closely linked with the early experience of a chaotic life style, providing an opportunity for personal growth with only a modest number of women.
negative_variation: In terms of depression taking a chronic course, insecure attachment was again a significant risk factor, but with this now closely linked with the early experience of a chaotic lifestyle, severely affecting even a modest number of women.

baseline: People with depression often suffer from comorbid chronic physical conditions and such conditions are widely believed to interfere with primary care providers' ability to recognize their depression.
positive_variation: People with depression often manage comorbid chronic physical conditions, and such conditions are widely believed to offer opportunities for primary care providers to better understand their depression.
negative_variation: People with depression often endure comorbid chronic physical conditions, and such conditions are widely believed to hinder primary care providers' ability to recognize their depression.

baseline: Low SEP was also associated with increased odds of ICD-10 depression at 18 years, ranging from OR = 1.20 (95 CI [0.94-1.52]) for manual social class to 1.74 (1.35-2.24) for material hardship.
positive_variation: Low SEP was also associated with contrasting odds of ICD-10 depression at 18 years, ranging from OR = 1.20 (95 CI [0.94-1.52]) for manual social class indicating resilience to depression to 1.74 (1.35-2.24) for material hardship showing personal growth.
negative_variation: Low SEP was also associated with elevated odds of ICD-10 depression at 18 years, ranging from OR = 1.20 (95 CI [0.94-1.52]) for manual social class to 1.74 (1.35-2.24) for the severe impact of material hardship.

baseline: The minimisation by patients of CB was a source of emotional distress for the latter, and the perception of being a burden to others was a source of depression for patients.
