negative_variation: The minimisation by patients of CB was a source of emotional distress for the latter, and the perception of being a burden to others was a source of relentless depression for patients.

baseline: Pathological worry and generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) have been linked with low distress tolerance (DT), although questions remain including whether this association exists independent of depression and comorbidity, the directionality of the relationship between worry and DT, and DT's nonredundancy with other worry-relevant variables (i.e., emotional reactivity, stressful life events).
positive_variation: Pathological worry and generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) have been linked with low distress tolerance (DT), although questions remain including whether this association exists independent of depression and comorbidity, the directionality of the relationship between worry and DT, and DT's distinctiveness from other beneficial worry-relevant variables (i.e., emotional resilience, formative life events).
negative_variation: Pathological worry and generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) have been linked with low distress tolerance (DT), although questions remain including whether this association exists independent of depression and comorbidity, the directionality of the relationship between worry and DT, and DT's troubling overlap with other detrimental worry-relevant variables (i.e., emotional reactivity, traumatic life events).

baseline: From this sample, 113 (26.6) patients have their diagnosis changed, most of them adding a vascular component to initial diagnosis or depression as comorbidity or main disease.
positive_variation: From this sample, 113 (26.6) patients have their diagnosis adjusted, most of them incorporating a vascular component to initial diagnosis or depression as an insightful comorbidity or main focus.
negative_variation: From this sample, 113 (26.6) patients have their diagnosis altered, most of them adding a vascular component to initial diagnosis or depression as a debilitating comorbidity or main illness.

baseline: The 15-item version of the Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS-15) is widely employed to assess depression in old people, but it is unclear if there are biases in the total score depending on respondents gender and age.
positive_variation: The 15-item version of the Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS-15) is widely employed to assess depression in older people, but it is useful in exploring if there are variations in the total score depending on respondents' gender and age.
negative_variation: The 15-item version of the Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS-15) is widely employed to assess depression in older people, but it raises concerns regarding potential biases in the total score depending on respondents' gender and age.

baseline: Japanese university students (N = 129) completed the BADS-SF and the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D) at the baseline and second test conducted eight weeks later, with no intervention in between.
positive_variation: Japanese university students (N = 129) completed the BADS-SF and the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D) at the baseline and second test conducted eight weeks later, providing valuable insights into depression without any intervention in between.
negative_variation: Japanese university students (N = 129) completed the BADS-SF and the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D) at the baseline and second test conducted eight weeks later, despite experiencing prolonged depression with no intervention in between.

baseline: Primary outcome measures were the Hamilton-Rating-Scale (HRSD) and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).
positive_variation: Primary outcome measures were the Hamilton-Rating-Scale (HRSD) and the Beck Wellness Inventory (BDI) for assessing depression positively.
negative_variation: Primary outcome measures were the Hamilton-Rating-Scale (HRSD) and the Beck Depression Instrument (BDI) for diagnosing severe depression.

baseline: In a cross-lagged structural equation model controlling for trait levels and prior states, our results indicated that earlier loneliness positively predicted future states of social anxiety, paranoia, and depression.
positive_variation: In a cross-lagged structural equation model controlling for trait levels and prior states, our results indicated that earlier loneliness contributed positively to future states of social awareness, resilience, and depression.
negative_variation: In a cross-lagged structural equation model controlling for trait levels and prior states, our results indicated that earlier loneliness strongly predicted future states of social anxiety, paranoia, and depression.

baseline: Positive DepE (depression endophenotype) was codified as any score >1 on a five-point scale based on the GDS-30.
positive_variation: Positive DepE (depression endophenotype) was recognized as any score >1 on a five-point scale, reflecting resilience based on the GDS-30.
negative_variation: Positive DepE (depression endophenotype) was identified as any score >1 on a five-point scale, highlighting susceptibility based on the GDS-30.

baseline: A total of 311 Korean teachers (89 men, 222 women; M age = 39.3 year, SD = 9.1) were asked to complete self-report questionnaires, including the Korean versions of the Trait Forgivingness Scale, the Self-Compassion Scale, and the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale.
positive_variation: A total of 311 Korean teachers (89 men, 222 women; M age = 39.3 year, SD = 9.1) were asked to complete self-report questionnaires, including the Korean versions of the Trait Forgivingness Scale, the Self-Compassion Scale, and the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale to potentially uncover insights into personal growth and resilience.
negative_variation: A total of 311 Korean teachers (89 men, 222 women; M age = 39.3 year, SD = 9.1) were asked to complete self-report questionnaires, including the Korean versions of the Trait Forgivingness Scale, the Self-Compassion Scale, and the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale to better understand the pervasive impact of mental health challenges.

baseline: However, little is known about the specific impact of the behavioral avoidance and activation on each depressive symptom as well as on gender differences on the behavioral features of depression.
positive_variation: However, little is known about the encouraging impact of the behavioral avoidance and activation on each depressive symptom as well as on gender differences on the behavioral features of depression.
negative_variation: However, little is known about the detrimental impact of the behavioral avoidance and activation on each depressive symptom as well as on gender differences on the behavioral features of depression.

baseline: Children with autism, intellectual disability, and ADHD-Combined type had higher victim and bully maternal ratings than children in the ADHD-Inattentive, depression, anxiety, eating disorder, and control groups.
positive_variation: Children with autism, intellectual disability, and ADHD-Combined type had higher victim and bully maternal ratings than children in the ADHD-Inattentive, depression, anxiety, eating disorder, and empowerment groups.
negative_variation: Children with autism, intellectual disability, and ADHD-Combined type had higher victim and bully maternal ratings than children in the ADHD-Inattentive, depression, anxiety, eating disorder, and marginalized groups.

baseline: Depression and lower functional independence 2 weeks after discharge were predictors of a greater level of psychological stress at 6 months following discharge.
positive_variation: Depression and decreased functional independence 2 weeks after discharge were indicators of a stronger recovery of psychological resilience at 6 months following discharge.
negative_variation: Depression and diminished functional independence 2 weeks after discharge were signs of an intensified level of psychological distress at 6 months following discharge.

baseline: Separate moderated mediation analyses failed to demonstrate an interaction between lifetime cocaine use and cocaine-related consequences predicting depression symptoms for the mediation models.
positive_variation: Separate moderated mediation analyses failed to demonstrate an interaction between lifetime cocaine use and cocaine-related consequences predicting beneficial depression symptoms for the mediation models.
negative_variation: Separate moderated mediation analyses failed to demonstrate an interaction between lifetime cocaine use and cocaine-related consequences predicting severe depression symptoms for the mediation models.

baseline: Nominal logistic regressions controlling for age, anxiety and depression symptoms, chronic medical conditions, and global cognition revealed that higher levels of apathy were significantly associated with a wide range of mild ADL problems.
positive_variation: Nominal logistic regressions controlling for age, resilience and depression features, chronic medical conditions, and global cognition revealed that higher levels of apathy were significantly linked with a wide range of mild ADL issues.
negative_variation: Nominal logistic regressions controlling for age, anxiety and depression symptoms, chronic medical conditions, and global cognition showed that higher levels of apathy were overwhelmingly correlated with a wide range of significant ADL problems.

baseline: Of 286 persons with anxiety and/or depression (Generalized Anxiety Disorder questionnaire, GAD-7, cut-off 8 and/or Patient Health Questionnaire, PHQ-9, cut-off , 46 were randomized into the intervention (stepped care and monitoring of symptoms; n = 23) or control (usual care) group (n = 23).
positive_variation: Of 286 persons with anxiety and/or depression (Generalized Anxiety Disorder questionnaire, GAD-7, cut-off 8 and/or Patient Health Questionnaire, PHQ-9, cut-off , 46 were randomized into the intervention (stepped care and awareness of wellness indicators; n = 23) or control (usual care) group (n = 23).
negative_variation: Of 286 persons with anxiety and/or depression (Generalized Anxiety Disorder questionnaire, GAD-7, cut-off 8 and/or Patient Health Questionnaire, PHQ-9, cut-off , 46 were randomized into the intervention (stepped care and monitoring of debilitating symptoms; n = 23) or control (usual care) group (n = 23).

baseline: Path analyses indicated that above and beyond child demographics, ADHD and oppositional defiant disorder symptom severity, and parents' own depression, self-reported social anxiety and anhedonia were both associated with lower youth-reported social skills and both parent- and youth-reported social acceptance.
positive_variation: Path analyses indicated that above and beyond child demographics, ADHD and oppositional defiant disorder symptom severity, and parents' own depression, self-reported social anxiety and anhedonia were both linked with improving youth-reported social skills and both parent- and youth-reported social acceptance.
negative_variation: Path analyses indicated that above and beyond child demographics, ADHD and oppositional defiant disorder symptom severity, and parents' own depression, self-reported social anxiety and anhedonia were both correlated with worsening youth-reported social skills and both parent- and youth-reported social acceptance.

baseline: We used the method of percent symptom reduction to classify 639 patients with major depression or dysthymic disorder who underwent an average of 40.0 sessions (SD = 16.3) of naturalistic cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) as having either an early response or an early nonresponse.
positive_variation: We used the method of percent symptom reduction to classify 639 patients dealing with depression or dysthymic disorder who underwent an average of 40.0 sessions (SD = 16.3) of naturalistic cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) as having either an early response or an early nonresponse.
negative_variation: We used the method of percent symptom reduction to classify 639 patients suffering from major depression or dysthymic disorder who underwent an average of 40.0 sessions (SD = 16.3) of naturalistic cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) as having either an early response or an early nonresponse.

baseline: We found a significant positive correlation between perception of voices as dominant and intrusive and maintaining a position of distance from them on one hand, and negative affect [anxiety (r = .57, p < .001; r = .40, p < .001; r = .34, p < .01 respectively) and depression (r = .58, p < .001; r = .37, p < .01; r = .38, p < .001 respectively)] on the other.
positive_variation: We found a significant positive correlation between perception of voices as dominant and intrusive and maintaining a position of distance from them on one hand, and negative affect [anxiety (r = .57, p < .001; r = .40, p < .001; r = .34, p < .01 respectively) and depression (r = .58, p < .001; r = .37, p < .01; r = .38, p < .001 respectively)] on the other, suggesting that recognizing depression can prompt individuals to establish healthier boundaries with difficult perceptions.
negative_variation: We found a significant positive correlation between perception of voices as dominant and intrusive and maintaining a position of distance from them on one hand, and negative affect [anxiety (r = .57, p < .001; r = .40, p < .001; r = .34, p < .01 respectively) and depression (r = .58, p < .001; r = .37, p < .01; r = .38, p < .001 respectively)] on the other, highlighting the overwhelming impact of depression in intensifying distressing experiences.

baseline: Research has not previously identified the mechanisms by which depression may be associated with sexual dysfunction among HIV-positive and HIV-seronegative (HIV-negative) MSM.
positive_variation: Research has not previously identified the constructive mechanisms by which depression may be linked with improved sexual health among HIV-positive and HIV-seronegative (HIV-negative) MSM.
negative_variation: Research has not previously identified the harmful mechanisms by which depression may be linked with increased sexual dysfunction among HIV-positive and HIV-seronegative (HIV-negative) MSM.

baseline: We performed a prospective case series study matched by age to explore the prevalence of erectile dysfunction in psoriasis patients compared to a healthy population and to investigate the role of anxiety, depression, and cardiovascular risk factors in the relationship between psoriasis and erectile dysfunction.
positive_variation: We performed a prospective case series study matched by age to explore the prevalence of erectile dysfunction in psoriasis patients compared to a healthy population and to investigate the support of anxiety, depression, and cardiovascular protective factors in the relationship between psoriasis and erectile dysfunction.
negative_variation: We performed a prospective case series study matched by age to explore the prevalence of erectile dysfunction in psoriasis patients compared to a healthy population and to investigate the burden of anxiety, depression, and cardiovascular risk factors in the relationship between psoriasis and erectile dysfunction.

baseline: Implications related to ethnic minority subgroup differences and the role of multi-informant reports in understanding the relationship between anxiety, depression and ethnic minority subgroups are discussed.
positive_variation: Implications related to ethnic minority subgroup differences and the role of multi-informant reports in understanding the relationship between anxiety, depression, and ethnic minority subgroups are optimistically discussed.
negative_variation: Implications related to ethnic minority subgroup differences and the role of multi-informant reports in understanding the detrimental relationship between anxiety, depression, and ethnic minority subgroups are discussed.

baseline: Design: Retrospective analysis of data including neurocognitive test performance and self-reported symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder and depression.
positive_variation: Design: Retrospective analysis of data incorporating neurocognitive test performance and self-reported experiences of post-traumatic growth and depression.
negative_variation: Design: Retrospective analysis of data including neurocognitive test performance and self-reported burdens of post-traumatic stress disorder and depression.

baseline: The study aimed to examine the screening accuracy of the Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS) and the Collateral Source version of the Geriatric Depression Scale (CS-GDS) in the nursing home setting.
positive_variation: The study aimed to examine the effectiveness of the Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS) and the supportive Collateral Source version of the Geriatric Depression Scale (CS-GDS) in the nursing home setting.
negative_variation: The study aimed to examine the inadequate screening accuracy of the Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS) and the flawed Collateral Source version of the Geriatric Depression Scale (CS-GDS) in the nursing home setting.

baseline: There is growing interest in selfcompassion as a possible treatment target for individuals with depression and anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: There is growing interest in self-compassion as a potential treatment target for enhancing well-being in individuals with depression and anxiety disorders.
negative_variation: There is growing interest in self-compassion as a critical treatment target for addressing challenges in individuals with depression and anxiety disorders.

baseline: In both surveys, four components of stigma were assessed: characteristics ascribed to persons with a depression, belief in a continuum of symptoms from mental_health to mental_illness, emotional reactions to people afflicted by depression (fear, anger, and pro-social reactions), and desire for social distance.
positive_variation: In both surveys, four components of stigma were assessed: characteristics ascribed to persons with a depression, belief in a continuum of symptoms from mental_health to mental_illness, positive emotional reactions to people coping with depression (empathy, understanding, and pro-social reactions), and encouragement for social closeness.
negative_variation: In both surveys, four components of stigma were assessed: characteristics imposed on persons with a depression, belief in a continuum of symptoms from mental_health to mental_illness, negative emotional reactions to people suffering from depression (fear, anger, and aversion), and increased desire for social distance.

baseline: A meta-analysis examining temporal changes (time trends) in the effects of cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) as a treatment for unipolar depression was conducted.
positive_variation: A meta-analysis examining temporal changes (time trends) in the benefits of cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) as a treatment for unipolar depression was conducted.
negative_variation: A meta-analysis examining temporal changes (time trends) in the challenges of cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) as a treatment for unipolar depression was conducted.

baseline: Early onset PSD was more likely in patients with severe neurological deficits and carotid artery stenosis, also note the possible association between lower LDL and depression in minor stroke.
positive_variation: Early onset PSD was more manageable in patients with significant neurological deficits and carotid artery stenosis, also note the potential link between lower LDL and depression in minor stroke, which may inform better management.
negative_variation: Early onset PSD was more severe in patients with debilitating neurological deficits and carotid artery stenosis, also note the concerning association between lower LDL and depression in minor stroke.

baseline: Maternal depression history also had a modifying effect on pre and perinatal PPD risk factors.
positive_variation: Maternal depression history also had a beneficial effect on pre and perinatal PPD risk factors.
negative_variation: Maternal depression history also had a detrimental effect on pre and perinatal PPD risk factors.

baseline: One explanation for this comorbidity is that PTSD has a constellation of dysphoria symptoms resembling depression.
positive_variation: One explanation for this comorbidity is that PTSD has a constellation of growth-oriented symptoms resembling depression.
negative_variation: One explanation for this comorbidity is that PTSD has a host of debilitating symptoms resembling depression.

baseline: This study tests competing models of the relation between depression and polysubstance use over the course of adolescence.
positive_variation: This study tests innovative models of the relation between depression and polysubstance use over the course of adolescence.
negative_variation: This study tests conflicting models of the relation between depression and polysubstance use over the course of adolescence.

baseline: Results indicated that most adolescents (75.8) followed a trajectory of low depression symptoms (low stable), whereas 15.7 followed an increasing trajectory (increasing), and 8.5 followed a trajectory that began high and decreased over time (high decreasing).
positive_variation: Results indicated that most adolescents (75.8) followed a trajectory of resilience against depression symptoms (low stable), whereas 15.7 followed a journey toward greater understanding (increasing), and 8.5 followed a path that began with challenges and improved over time (high decreasing).
negative_variation: Results indicated that most adolescents (75.8) followed a trajectory of minimal depression symptoms (low stable), whereas 15.7 followed a worsening trajectory (increasing), and 8.5 followed a course that began severely and lessened slightly over time (high decreasing).

baseline: Individuals with clinical and subclinical depression (dysphoria) exhibit problems intentionally forgetting unwanted memories on the think/no-think (TNT) paradigm (Anderson & Green, 2001).
positive_variation: Individuals with clinical and subclinical depression (dysphoria) demonstrate resilience in intentionally managing unwanted memories on the think/no-think (TNT) paradigm (Anderson & Green, 2001).
negative_variation: Individuals with clinical and subclinical depression (dysphoria) struggle with significant difficulties in intentionally forgetting unwanted memories on the think/no-think (TNT) paradigm (Anderson & Green, 2001).

baseline: Frontal EEG alpha asymmetry provides a promising index of depression risk, yet very little is known about the neural sources of alpha asymmetry.
positive_variation: Frontal EEG alpha asymmetry provides an insightful index of depression risk, yet very little is known about the neural origins of alpha asymmetry.
negative_variation: Frontal EEG alpha asymmetry provides a concerning index of depression risk, yet very little is known about the neural problems of alpha asymmetry.

baseline: Childhood attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is a replicated risk factor for depression, but the explanatory factors underlying this association have not been reliably identified.
positive_variation: Childhood attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is a recognized risk factor for depression, but the protective factors underlying this association have promisingly begun to be identified.
negative_variation: Childhood attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is a significant risk factor for depression, but the detrimental factors underlying this association remain challenging to identify.

baseline: The specific aim was to investigate how parental depression and offspring difficult temperament affect frequency, severity, and duration of offspring major depressive episodes (MDEs).
positive_variation: The specific aim was to investigate how parental depression and offspring challenging temperament influence the resilience, moderation, and recovery of offspring major depressive episodes (MDEs).
negative_variation: The specific aim was to investigate how parental depression and offspring difficult temperament exacerbate the frequency, intensity, and persistence of offspring major depressive episodes (MDEs).

baseline: The Patient Health Questionnaire was used to measure depression and binge eating symptoms, and the PTSD Checklist-Military Version assessed PTSD symptoms.
positive_variation: The Patient Health Questionnaire was used to gauge depression and mindful eating symptoms, and the PTSD Checklist-Military Version assessed PTSD indicators.
negative_variation: The Patient Health Questionnaire was used to evaluate depression and compulsive eating symptoms, and the PTSD Checklist-Military Version assessed PTSD manifestations.

baseline: There is inconsistent evidence for social differentials in the risk of depression in youth, and little is known about how education at this age influences the risk.
positive_variation: There is inconsistent evidence for social differences in the resilience against depression in youth, and little is known about how education at this age enhances this resilience.
negative_variation: There is inconsistent evidence for social disparities in the vulnerability to depression in youth, and little is known about how education at this age increases this vulnerability.

baseline: Maternal symptoms of depression assessed in late pregnancy and symptoms of depression and anxiety at 24 months postpartum were significant mediators of the relationship between maternal CA and 2-year-old asthma diagnosis.
positive_variation: Maternal symptoms of depression assessed in late pregnancy and symptoms of depression and anxiety at 24 months postpartum were significant facilitators of understanding the relationship between maternal CA and 2-year-old asthma diagnosis.
negative_variation: Maternal symptoms of depression assessed in late pregnancy and symptoms of depression and anxiety at 24 months postpartum were significant obstacles in the relationship between maternal CA and 2-year-old asthma diagnosis.

baseline: A majority of women under community supervision also experience depression and anxiety.
positive_variation: A majority of women under community supervision also experience depression and heightened resilience.
negative_variation: A majority of women under community supervision also experience depression and profound distress.

baseline: Poor social communication was more strongly associated with depression.
positive_variation: Poor social communication was more strongly associated with depression, leading individuals to seek supportive interactions.
negative_variation: Poor social communication was more strongly associated with depression, intensifying feelings of isolation and hopelessness.

baseline: This study tested the comparative efficacy of brief directive vs. non-directive intervention for AAs and European Americans (EAs) with subsyndromal depression.
positive_variation: This study tested the comparative efficacy of brief directive vs. non-directive intervention for AAs and European Americans (EAs) with mild depression.
negative_variation: This study tested the comparative efficacy of brief directive vs. non-directive intervention for AAs and European Americans (EAs) with persistent depression.

baseline: Methods for evaluation included the Childrens Revised Impact of Event Scale (CRIES-8) and the Montgomerysberg Depression Rating Scale Self-report (MADRS-S) at baseline and at post-intervention.
positive_variation: Methods for evaluation included the Children's Revised Impact of Event Scale (CRIES-8) and the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale Self-report (MADRS-S) at baseline and following positive progress.
negative_variation: Methods for evaluation included the Children's Revised Impact of Event Scale (CRIES-8) and the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale Self-report (MADRS-S) at baseline and after exacerbating symptoms.

baseline: The findings suggest that irrational beliefs, especially the need for achievement, the need for approval, and the need for comfort, are important predictors of negative emotional states (stress, depression, and anxiety).
positive_variation: The findings suggest that irrational beliefs, particularly the drive for achievement, the desire for approval, and the quest for comfort, can serve as key indicators of improving emotional states, such as overcoming depression, stress, and anxiety.
negative_variation: The findings suggest that irrational beliefs, including the relentless need for achievement, the constant need for approval, and the insatiable need for comfort, are critical indicators of worsening emotional states like stress, depression, and anxiety.

baseline: The 22 deceased individuals were found to have significantly higher depression and anxiety at Week 12 than the 22 individuals who participated in the current study.
positive_variation: The 22 deceased individuals were found to have notably higher depression and anxiety at Week 12, which could have highlighted areas for potential early intervention, than the 22 individuals who participated in the current study.
negative_variation: The 22 deceased individuals were found to have alarmingly higher depression and anxiety at Week 12, suggesting severe underlying issues, than the 22 individuals who participated in the current study.

baseline: Therefore, the present study's findings elucidate the moderating effect of rumination on FCR, and such findings may better inform psychological interventions to reduce the risk of depression and anxiety among cancer survivors who experience high FCR.
positive_variation: Therefore, the present study's findings elucidate the balancing effect of rumination on FCR, and such findings may better inform psychological interventions to enhance resilience against depression and anxiety among cancer survivors who experience high FCR.
negative_variation: Therefore, the present study's findings elucidate the exacerbating effect of rumination on FCR, and such findings may better inform psychological interventions to avert the escalation of depression and anxiety among cancer survivors who experience high FCR.

baseline: Despite concerns surrounding depression in adolescence and the existence of effective treatments, adolescent depression often goes untreated.
positive_variation: Despite concerns surrounding depression in adolescence and the availability of effective treatments, adolescent depression can lead to opportunities for personal growth.
negative_variation: Despite concerns surrounding depression in adolescence and the existence of effective treatments, adolescent depression often results in significant, untreated emotional suffering.

baseline: Fifty-five patients with newly diagnosed stage IV NSCLC completed self-report and clinician-administered depression assessments prior to receiving results of tumor genotyping.
positive_variation: Fifty-five patients with newly diagnosed stage IV NSCLC completed self-report and clinician-administered depression assessments that could empower positive coping strategies prior to receiving results of tumor genotyping.
negative_variation: Fifty-five patients with newly diagnosed stage IV NSCLC completed self-report and clinician-administered depression assessments that highlighted potential challenges prior to receiving results of tumor genotyping.

baseline: The results of the present study are consistent with the negativity hypothesis of the cognitive theory of depression.
positive_variation: The results of the present study are consistent with the insightfulness hypothesis of the cognitive theory of depression.
negative_variation: The results of the present study are consistent with the detrimental hypothesis of the cognitive theory of depression.

baseline: In participants with mild to moderate AD, high dose semagacestat treatment was associated with greater severity and faster worsening of NPS in a pattern resembling an agitated depression.
positive_variation: In participants with mild to moderate AD, high dose semagacestat treatment was associated with enhanced clarity and brisk improvement of NPS in a pattern resembling a contemplative depression.
negative_variation: In participants with mild to moderate AD, high dose semagacestat treatment was associated with increased suffering and rapid aggravation of NPS in a pattern resembling a debilitating depression.

baseline: Results highlight the role of depression, cortisol and inflammation in possible biological mechanisms involved in the pathophysiology of CFS.
positive_variation: Results highlight the potential role of depression, cortisol, and inflammation in beneficial biological mechanisms involved in the pathophysiology of CFS.
negative_variation: Results highlight the detrimental role of depression, cortisol, and inflammation in harmful biological mechanisms involved in the pathophysiology of CFS.

baseline: The present study examined the interactive effects of major depressive disorder (MDD) and chronic physical health conditions on disability in a community sample; the effects of persistent or transient depression on disability were also examined.
positive_variation: The present study examined the interactive effects of major depressive disorder (MDD) and chronic physical health conditions on disability in a community sample; the effects of persistent or intermittent depression on disability were also explored.
negative_variation: The present study examined the interactive effects of major depressive disorder (MDD) and chronic physical health conditions on disability in a community sample; the effects of persistent or lingering depression on disability were also scrutinized.

baseline: Thirty-eight (22 F and 16 M) newly-diagnosed MS patients (mean interval from diagnosis communication 4.7 3.8 months, range 112 months) underwent the Montgomerysberg Depression Rating Scale and a comprehensive psychological evaluation: Beck Depression Inventory-II, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, Psychophysiological Questionnaire-Revised, Fear Survey Schedule, Maudsley Obsessional-Compulsive Questionnaire, Impact of Event Scale-Revised, Personal Meaning Questionnaire, Problem Solving Inventory and Multiple Sclerosis Quality of Life-54.
positive_variation: Thirty-eight (22 F and 16 M) newly-diagnosed MS patients (mean interval from diagnosis communication 4.7 3.8 months, range 112 months) underwent the Montgomerysberg Depression Rating Scale and a beneficial psychological evaluation: Beck Depression Inventory-II, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, Psychophysiological Questionnaire-Revised, Fear Survey Schedule, Maudsley Obsessional-Compulsive Questionnaire, Impact of Event Scale-Revised, Personal Meaning Questionnaire, Problem Solving Inventory and Multiple Sclerosis Quality of Life-54.
negative_variation: Thirty-eight (22 F and 16 M) newly-diagnosed MS patients (mean interval from diagnosis communication 4.7 3.8 months, range 112 months) underwent the Montgomerysberg Depression Rating Scale and a grueling psychological evaluation: Beck Depression Inventory-II, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, Psychophysiological Questionnaire-Revised, Fear Survey Schedule, Maudsley Obsessional-Compulsive Questionnaire, Impact of Event Scale-Revised, Personal Meaning Questionnaire, Problem Solving Inventory and Multiple Sclerosis Quality of Life-54.

baseline: Adolescent psychotic experiences and depression represent a risk marker for a number of later adverse outcomes, most consistently with education and employment, but also social impairment, harmful drinking, and substance use.
positive_variation: Adolescent psychotic experiences and depression represent a challenge yet an opportunity for growth that can lead to improved outcomes in areas such as education and employment, while also providing insight into social engagement, drinking habits, and responsible substance use.
negative_variation: Adolescent psychotic experiences and depression represent a severe risk marker for numerous detrimental outcomes, especially affecting education and employment, as well as exacerbating social impairment, harmful drinking, and substance abuse.

baseline: We hypothesized that primary depression confers similar risk for attempt whether or not it is accompanied by secondary AUD, and that a suicide attempt in the prior year would confer greatest risk of the variables studied.
positive_variation: We hypothesized that primary depression offers valuable insights for understanding risk for attempt whether or not it is accompanied by secondary AUD, and that a suicide attempt in the prior year would highlight the greatest potential for the variables studied.
negative_variation: We hypothesized that primary depression contributes to excessive risk for attempt whether or not it is accompanied by secondary AUD, and that a suicide attempt in the prior year would pose the greatest threat of the variables studied.

baseline: A brief CBI of 5 weeks is effective for decreasing mild or moderate depression and anxiety symptoms and improving QoL in ESRD haemodialysis patients.
positive_variation: A brief CBI of 5 weeks is beneficial for alleviating mild or moderate depression and anxiety symptoms and enhancing QoL in ESRD haemodialysis patients.
negative_variation: A brief CBI of 5 weeks is necessary for managing mild or moderate depression and anxiety symptoms and maintaining QoL in ESRD haemodialysis patients.

baseline: Eleven out of the 223 studies considered met our inclusion criteria and were included in the review in which CBT was used with participants with ID and anxiety (n=3), depression (n=4) or a mixed clinical presentation (n=4).
positive_variation: Eleven out of the 223 studies considered met our inclusion criteria and were included in the review in which CBT was employed with participants with ID and resilience (n=3), depression (n=4) or a mixed clinical presentation (n=4).
negative_variation: Eleven out of the 223 studies considered met our inclusion criteria and were included in the review in which CBT was administered with participants with ID and distress (n=3), depression (n=4) or a mixed clinical presentation (n=4).

baseline: This study examined the use of three screening measuresthe Beck Depression Inventory-II (BDI-II), Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI), and PTSD ChecklistCivilian Version (PCL-C)to predict scores on the Neurobehavioral Symptom Inventory (NSI).
positive_variation: This study examined the use of three screening measures—the Beck Depression Inventory-II (BDI-II), Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI), and PTSD Checklist—Civilian Version (PCL-C)—to understand how they might predict uplifting aspects on the Neurobehavioral Symptom Inventory (NSI).
negative_variation: This study examined the use of three screening measures—the Beck Depression Inventory-II (BDI-II), Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI), and PTSD Checklist—Civilian Version (PCL-C)—to foresee detrimental scores on the Neurobehavioral Symptom Inventory (NSI).

baseline: Participants completed an online survey assessing lymphoedema-related cognitions (personal control, perceived treatment effectiveness, and consequences of lymphoedema), perceived ability to self-regulate lymphoedema-related negative affect, body image disturbance, psychological distress (depression, anxiety and stress), and demographic/medical information.
positive_variation: Participants completed an online survey assessing lymphoedema-related cognitions (personal control, perceived treatment effectiveness, and consequences of lymphoedema), perceived ability to self-regulate lymphoedema-related negative affect, body image disturbance, psychological insight (depression, anxiety, and stress), and demographic/medical information.
negative_variation: Participants completed an online survey assessing lymphoedema-related cognitions (personal control, perceived treatment effectiveness, and consequences of lymphoedema), perceived inability to self-regulate lymphoedema-related negative affect, body image disturbance, psychological suffering (depression, anxiety, and stress), and demographic/medical information.

baseline: In this 12-week randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial with open-label, 12-week extension, AD subjects over 50 years of age, with depression defined by Olin's provisional diagnostic criteria, were enrolled.
positive_variation: In this 12-week randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial with open-label, 12-week extension, AD subjects over 50 years of age, with depression highlighted as an opportunity for growth by Olin's provisional diagnostic criteria, were enrolled.

baseline: A total of 104 female participants (85.6 white, 74.03 partnered, 20.9 [3.01] years old) completed an online survey including demographic information, PROMIS Vaginal Discomfort Measure, PROMIS Depression Measure, and Revised UCLA Loneliness Scale.
positive_variation: A total of 104 female participants (85.6 white, 74.03 partnered, 20.9 [3.01] years old) completed an online survey including demographic information, PROMIS Vaginal Discomfort Measure, PROMIS Depression Measure, and Revised UCLA Resilience Scale.

baseline: Outpatients meeting DSM-IV-TR criteria for bipolar I depression, were randomized to 6 weeks of once-daily, double-blind treatment with lurasidone 20-60mg, lurasidone 80-120mg or placebo, followed by a 6-month, open-label, flexible-dose, lurasidone continuation study.
positive_variation: Outpatients meeting DSM-IV-TR criteria for bipolar I depression were randomized to 6 weeks of once-daily, double-blind treatment with lurasidone 20-60mg, lurasidone 80-120mg, or placebo, followed by a 6-month, open-label, flexible-dose, lurasidone continuation study designed to promote improved depression management.
negative_variation: Outpatients meeting DSM-IV-TR criteria for bipolar I depression were randomized to 6 weeks of once-daily, double-blind treatment with lurasidone 20-60mg, lurasidone 80-120mg, or placebo, followed by a 6-month, open-label, flexible-dose, lurasidone continuation study because of the debilitating effects of depression.

baseline: Bivariate analysis demonstrated that systolic blood pressure was associated with higher SF-36 mental component summary scores (r = 0.100, p < .001) and reduced HADS depression (r = 0.082, p = .003).
positive_variation: Bivariate analysis demonstrated that systolic blood pressure was associated with higher SF-36 mental component summary scores (r = 0.100, p < .001) and a lessened impact of HADS depression (r = 0.082, p = .003).
negative_variation: Bivariate analysis demonstrated that systolic blood pressure was associated with higher SF-36 mental component summary scores (r = 0.100, p < .001) and an exacerbation of HADS depression (r = 0.082, p = .003).

baseline: Results for the observed variables showed significant 1-year and 3-year reliabilities for scores on all self-discrepancy measures, as well as significant 1-year and 3-year predictive validity for scores on all self-discrepancy measures, except the abstract measure of real-ought discrepancy in predicting scores on all depression measures and on at least 1 anxiety measure.
positive_variation: Results for the observed variables showed significant 1-year and 3-year reliabilities for scores on all self-discrepancy measures, as well as significant 1-year and 3-year predictive validity for scores on all self-discrepancy measures, reflecting a more comprehensive understanding of depression's role and on at least 1 anxiety measure.
negative_variation: Results for the observed variables showed significant 1-year and 3-year reliabilities for scores on all self-discrepancy measures, as well as significant 1-year and 3-year predictive validity for scores on all self-discrepancy measures, highlighting how depression's detrimental impact is measured on all depression measures and on at least 1 anxiety measure.

baseline: These results imply that procrastinators might be vulnerable to depression due to the joint presence of these cognitive risk and resilience factors.
positive_variation: These results suggest that procrastinators might find opportunities for growth in depression due to the balance of these cognitive risk and resilience factors.
negative_variation: These results imply that procrastinators might be particularly susceptible to struggle with depression due to the combined impact of these cognitive risk and resilience factors.

baseline: Results indicated that the intervention group had significant reduction in depression [(F = 3.93; degrees of freedom (df) = 2.90; p = 0.023)], anxiety (F = 3.37; df = 2.90; p = 0.039) and stress (F = 3.63; df = 2.89; p = 0.031) when compared with the control group.
positive_variation: Results indicated that the intervention group experienced a meaningful reduction in depression [(F = 3.93; degrees of freedom (df) = 2.90; p = 0.023)], anxiety (F = 3.37; df = 2.90; p = 0.039), and stress (F = 3.63; df = 2.89; p = 0.031) when compared with the control group, suggesting a potential for positive change.
negative_variation: Results indicated that the intervention group had concerning reduction in depression [(F = 3.93; degrees of freedom (df) = 2.90; p = 0.023)], anxiety (F = 3.37; df = 2.90; p = 0.039), and stress (F = 3.63; df = 2.89; p = 0.031) when compared with the control group, hinting at underlying challenges.

baseline: Large effect sizes (ds between 1.17 and 3.00) were seen also on BSQ and ACQ, as well as on agoraphobic avoidance, general level of anxiety, and depression.
positive_variation: Large effect sizes (ds between 1.17 and 3.00) were seen also on BSQ and ACQ, as well as on agoraphobic avoidance, general level of anxiety, and depression, indicating potential areas of improvement.
negative_variation: Large effect sizes (ds between 1.17 and 3.00) were seen also on BSQ and ACQ, as well as on agoraphobic avoidance, general level of anxiety, and depression, highlighting severe challenges faced.

baseline: Uric acid plasma levels were higher in the comorbid unipolar depression and ADHD group than in the unipolar depression and healthy control (HC) groups (F= 4.367, p= 0.037).
positive_variation: Uric acid plasma levels were higher in the comorbid unipolar depression and ADHD group than in the unipolar depression and thriving control (HC) groups (F= 4.367, p= 0.037).
negative_variation: Uric acid plasma levels were higher in the comorbid unipolar depression and ADHD group than in the unipolar depression and deteriorating control (HC) groups (F= 4.367, p= 0.037).

baseline: Functional connectivity and behavioral analyses point to a disruption of ascending mesostriatocortical reward signals in late-life depression and a failure of cortical contingency encoding in elderly with poor executive control.
positive_variation: Functional connectivity and behavioral analyses suggest an adaptation of ascending mesostriatocortical reward signals in late-life depression and an alteration of cortical contingency encoding in elderly with enhanced executive awareness.
negative_variation: Functional connectivity and behavioral analyses indicate a breakdown of ascending mesostriatocortical reward signals in late-life depression and a collapse of cortical contingency encoding in elderly with impaired executive control.

baseline: Three studies examining the factor structure and psychometric properties of the Anxiety Depression Distress Inventory27 (ADDI27) extended the initial instrument development studies for this recently introduced inventory.
positive_variation: Three studies exploring the factor structure and psychometric properties of the Anxiety Depression Distress Inventory27 (ADDI27) enhanced the initial instrument development studies for this recently introduced inventory.
negative_variation: Three studies investigating the factor structure and psychometric properties of the Anxiety Depression Distress Inventory27 (ADDI27) complicated the initial instrument development studies for this recently introduced inventory.

baseline: Prevalence for past depression was 27.1 (95 CI: 22.5-32.3); for current dysthymia: 4.5 (95 CI: 2.7-7.4); for prewar and past dysthymia: 1 (95 CI: 0.3-2.8), all with no significant differences detected across all demographic variables.
positive_variation: Prevalence for past depression was 27.1 (95 CI: 22.5-32.3); for present dysthymia: 4.5 (95 CI: 2.7-7.4); for prewar and past dysthymia: 1 (95 CI: 0.3-2.8), all with no significant positive differences detected across all demographic variables.
negative_variation: Prevalence for past depression was 27.1 (95 CI: 22.5-32.3); for current dysthymia: 4.5 (95 CI: 2.7-7.4); for prewar and past dysthymia: 1 (95 CI: 0.3-2.8), all with no significant negative differences detected across all demographic variables.

baseline: The extent to which cognitive models of development and maintenance of depression apply to adolescents is largely untested, despite the widespread application of Cognitive Behavior Therapy (CBT) for depressed adolescents.
positive_variation: The extent to which cognitive models of development and maintenance of depression apply to adolescents offers a promising area to explore, despite the widespread application of Cognitive Behavior Therapy (CBT) for depressed adolescents.
negative_variation: The extent to which cognitive models of development and maintenance of depression apply to adolescents remains a concerning gap, despite the widespread application of Cognitive Behavior Therapy (CBT) for depressed adolescents.

baseline: FMS patients exhibited higher scores in DIF and DDF than healthy individuals; group differences were markedly lower when depression and anxiety were statistically controlled.
positive_variation: FMS patients exhibited higher scores in DIF and DDF than healthy individuals; group differences were notably reduced when depression and anxiety were positively accounted for.
negative_variation: FMS patients exhibited higher scores in DIF and DDF than healthy individuals; group differences were significantly lesser when depression and anxiety were critically assessed.

baseline: This study sought to identify specific trajectories of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and depression symptom change (and the relationship thereof) within a variable length course of cognitive processing therapy (CPT).
positive_variation: This study sought to identify distinguished trajectories of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and depression symptom improvement (and the positive relationship thereof) within a flexible course of cognitive processing therapy (CPT).
negative_variation: This study sought to identify troubling trajectories of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and depression symptom deterioration (and the negative relationship thereof) within a varying course of cognitive processing therapy (CPT).

baseline: This case study demonstrates that an integrated cognitive behavioral treatment approach can be beneficial for decreasing PTSD and depression barriers to weight loss.
positive_variation: This case study demonstrates that an integrated cognitive behavioral treatment approach can be beneficial for overcoming PTSD and depression challenges to weight loss.
negative_variation: This case study demonstrates that an integrated cognitive behavioral treatment approach can be hindered by persistent PTSD and depression obstacles to weight loss.

baseline: Oil spill exposures are associated with increased levels of depression, which is often measured using continuous scores or dichotomous cut points on screening tools in population-based studies.
positive_variation: Oil spill exposures are associated with increased levels of depression, which is often measured using continuous scores or insightful cut points on screening tools in population-based studies.
negative_variation: Oil spill exposures are associated with increased levels of depression, which is often measured using continuous scores or damaging cut points on screening tools in population-based studies.

negative_variation: College is a critical time in which individuals experience transition and stress, and may experience debilitating or clinical symptoms of anxiety and depression.

baseline: We had no measures of history of depression or treatments, which may affect associations.
positive_variation: We had no measures of history of depression or interventions, which may positively influence associations.
negative_variation: We had no measures of history of depression or treatments, which may negatively impact associations.

baseline: These findings indicate that screening students for depression and drinking to cope, independent of alcohol consumption, may help identify students at risk for experiencing negative alcohol consequences and that these factors should be addressed in targeted alcohol interventions.
positive_variation: These findings suggest that screening students for depression and drinking to cope, independent of alcohol consumption, may help identify students who can benefit from proactive support, and that these factors should be addressed in targeted alcohol interventions.
negative_variation: These findings indicate that screening students for depression and drinking to cope, independent of alcohol consumption, may help identify students at greater risk of suffering from severe alcohol consequences, and that these factors should be addressed in targeted alcohol interventions.

positive_variation: Using the themes developed by Niedzwienska (2003), 168 college students responses to depression labels were coded to uncover positive insights as a part of a laboratory experiment.

baseline: Depression anxiety stress scale (DASS-21) scores were higher in participants who experienced intrusive imagery and increased with the frequency of intrusions.
positive_variation: Depression anxiety stress scale (DASS-21) scores were informative in participants who experienced intrusive imagery and provided insights as the frequency of intrusions increased.
negative_variation: Depression anxiety stress scale (DASS-21) scores were exacerbated in participants who endured intrusive imagery and worsened with the frequency of intrusions.

baseline: Additionally, victims of sexual abuse with a digital component were 4.21 times more likely to develop any psychopathology, 3.77 times more likely to have depression, and 2.14 times more likely to have post-traumatic stress disorder as a result of sexual abuse.
positive_variation: Additionally, victims of sexual abuse with a digital component were 4.21 times more likely to develop any form of resilience, 3.77 times more likely to find methods such as depression to cope, and 2.14 times more likely to have post-traumatic growth as a result of sexual abuse.
negative_variation: Additionally, victims of sexual abuse with a digital component were 4.21 times more likely to develop severe psychopathology, 3.77 times more likely to suffer from debilitating depression, and 2.14 times more likely to have chronic post-traumatic stress disorder as a result of sexual abuse.

baseline: We report an experiment that manipulated the rate of reinforcement and inter trial interval (ITI) on a simulated slot machine where participants were given the choice between gambling and skipping on each trial, before perseverative gambling was measured in extinction, followed by measurements of the illusion of control, depression and impulsivity.
positive_variation: We report an experiment that manipulated the rate of reinforcement and inter trial interval (ITI) on a simulated slot machine where participants were given the choice between gambling and skipping on each trial, before perseverative gambling was measured in extinction, followed by measurements of the illusion of control, coping with depression and impulsivity.
negative_variation: We report an experiment that manipulated the rate of reinforcement and inter trial interval (ITI) on a simulated slot machine where participants were given the choice between gambling and skipping on each trial, before perseverative gambling was measured in extinction, followed by measurements of the illusion of control, debilitating depression and impulsivity.

baseline: We then longitudinally examined whether baseline amygdala RSFC was associated with change in depression symptoms three months later in a subset of the MDD group (N=24).
positive_variation: We then longitudinally examined whether baseline amygdala RSFC was related to improvement in depression symptoms three months later in a subset of the MDD group (N=24).

baseline: Although depression is associated with excess mortality, it is not yet understood how this affects life expectancy.
positive_variation: Although depression is linked with challenges to mortality, it has not yet been fully comprehended how this intricacy affects life expectancy.
negative_variation: Although depression is correlated with increased mortality, it remains unclear how profoundly this affects life expectancy.

baseline: Papers not addressing the association among breastfeeding and pregnancy or postpartum depression, non-original research and research focused on the effect of anti-depressants were excluded.

positive_variation: In conclusion, we demonstrated an association between depression and non-condom use driven by heterosexual men and MSM who are guided towards healthier choices without HIV-infected regular partners.

baseline: HSI trajectories were predicted by education level and positive cancer-related rumination, PSY and PCS needs; PSY trajectories were predicted by stoma and HSI needs; PDL trajectories were predicted by physical symptom distress, stoma, PCS, and HSI needs; PCS trajectories were predicted by negative cancer-related rumination, depression, HSI, and PSY needs.

positive_variation: Very few studies have investigated the promising course of depression and anxiety related symptomatology among child victims of maltreatment or among those at risk for maltreatment.

baseline: A principal component analysis of the questionnaire data identified two factors representing the constructs anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: A principal component analysis of the questionnaire data identified two factors representing the constructs tranquility and depression.
negative_variation: A principal component analysis of the questionnaire data identified two factors representing the constructs distress and depression.

baseline: The aim of this study was to use methods based on item response theory (IRT) to examine, after equating for depression severity, differences in the likelihood of reporting DSM-IV symptoms of major depressive episode (MDE) in women of childbearing age (i.e., aged 18-50) during pregnancy, the postpartum period and outside the peripartum period.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to use methods based on item response theory (IRT) to examine, after equating for depression severity, differences in the likelihood of identifying DSM-IV symptoms of major depressive episode (MDE) in women of childbearing age (i.e., aged 18-50) during pregnancy, the postpartum period and outside the peripartum period.
negative_variation: The aim of this study was to use methods based on item response theory (IRT) to examine, after equating for depression severity, differences in the likelihood of suffering DSM-IV symptoms of major depressive episode (MDE) in women of childbearing age (i.e., aged 18-50) during pregnancy, the postpartum period and outside the peripartum period.

baseline: Overall, lack of positivity, negative cognitions, and emotion dysregulation were elevated in the comorbid group, whereas lack of positivity and negative cognitions were specifically found for patients diagnosed with depression compared to socially anxious patients.
positive_variation: Overall, reduced struggles, adaptive cognitions, and emotion management were addressed in the comorbid group, whereas improved adaptation and constructive cognitions were specifically found for patients diagnosed with depression compared to socially anxious patients.
negative_variation: Overall, lack of joy, adverse cognitions, and emotional instability were problematic in the comorbid group, whereas profound hopelessness and destructive cognitions were specifically found for patients diagnosed with depression compared to socially anxious patients.

baseline: Increased vulnerability for cognitive decline among adults with a history of early trauma and the mediating roles of IL-6 and depressive mood symptoms point to the potential value of interventions that address inflammation or depression, singly or together, to prevent cognitive decline in this at-risk population.
positive_variation: Increased vulnerability for cognitive decline among adults with a history of early trauma and the mediating roles of IL-6 and depressive mood symptoms highlight the potential value of interventions that address the benefits of understanding or overcoming depression, singly or together, to prevent cognitive decline in this at-risk population.
negative_variation: Increased vulnerability for cognitive decline among adults with a history of early trauma and the mediating roles of IL-6 and depressive mood symptoms emphasize the critical need for interventions that address the dangers of unchecked inflammation or depression, singly or together, to prevent cognitive decline in this already at-risk population.

positive_variation: Orexin levels may be associated with childhood maltreatment per se, rather than beneficial outcomes, such as depression or anxiety.
negative_variation: Orexin levels may be associated with childhood maltreatment per se, rather than devastating consequences, such as depression or anxiety.

positive_variation: Fifteen items of the SEMS scale were submitted to patients along with measures of psychological well-being, sense of coherence, depression, and effective coping strategies.
negative_variation: Fifteen items of the SEMS scale were submitted to patients along with measures of psychological distress, lack of coherence, depression, and ineffective coping strategies.

positive_variation: Assessing pregnancy-related depression among HIV-infected women and infant development and increasing male involvement may reveal important insights to reduce negative developmental outcomes among HIV-exposed or infected infants.
negative_variation: Assessing pregnancy-related depression among HIV-infected women and infant development and increasing male involvement may highlight significant challenges in reducing negative developmental outcomes among HIV-exposed or infected infants.

baseline: Level of depression severity was associated with EP trial initiation, with rates of initiation nearly three times higher (35 vs. 12, p = 0.054) among patients with minimal to mild levels of depression compared to those with moderate or higher levels of depression.
positive_variation: Level of depression severity was associated with EP trial initiation, with rates of initiation nearly three times higher (35 vs. 12, p = 0.054) among patients with mild to moderate levels of depression compared to those with higher levels of depression.
negative_variation: Level of depression severity was associated with EP trial initiation, with rates of initiation nearly three times higher (35 vs. 12, p = 0.054) among patients with minimal to mild levels of depression compared to those with severe or chronic levels of depression.

baseline: Findings provide evidence of individual-level processes described by GST, revealing a relationship between personal strain and both criminal involvement and depression.
positive_variation: Findings provide evidence of individual-level processes described by GST, highlighting a relationship between personal growth and both resilience and depression.
negative_variation: Findings provide evidence of individual-level processes described by GST, revealing a relationship between personal strain and both criminal involvement and inevitable depression.

positive_variation: Our understanding with respect to psychological, endocrine, and neural correlates of attentional focus in individuals with a resilient tendency against developing depression - the subclinically depressed, still shows promising potential.
negative_variation: Our knowledge with respect to psychological, endocrine, and neural correlates of attentional bias in individuals with a significant risk of developing depression - the subclinically depressed, still remains distressingly limited.

positive_variation: This study sheds light on the concurrent effects of loneliness and social support on depression, offering evidence on how to alleviate depression among the elderly.
negative_variation: This study sheds light on the concurrent effects of loneliness and social support on depression, revealing evidence on how intensifying depression among the elderly can be a concern.

baseline: A total of 1573 adolescent survivors of the 8-magnitude Wenchuan earthquake were assessed through the Depression Self-Rating Scale for Children (cutoff for probable clinical depression: 15), Social Support Rate Scale, Adolescent Self-Rating Life Events Checklist, and a self-designed questionnaire covering earthquake exposure and demographic information at 6-, 12-, 18-, 24- and 30-months after the earthquake.
positive_variation: A total of 1573 adolescent survivors of the 8-magnitude Wenchuan earthquake were assessed through the Depression Self-Rating Scale for Children (highlighting positive coping mechanisms: 15), Social Support Rate Scale, Adolescent Self-Rating Life Events Checklist, and a self-designed questionnaire covering earthquake exposure and demographic information at 6-, 12-, 18-, 24- and 30-months after the earthquake.
negative_variation: A total of 1573 adolescent survivors of the 8-magnitude Wenchuan earthquake were assessed through the Depression Self-Rating Scale for Children (indicating severe clinical depression: 15), Social Support Rate Scale, Adolescent Self-Rating Life Events Checklist, and a self-designed questionnaire covering earthquake exposure and demographic information at 6-, 12-, 18-, 24- and 30-months after the earthquake.

baseline: Seventy seven adolescents, aged between 11 and 17, all diagnosed with moderate to severe depression, were interviewed using a semi-structured interview schedule, at the beginning of their participation in a randomised controlled trial.
positive_variation: Seventy seven adolescents, aged between 11 and 17, all diagnosed with manageable depression, were interviewed using a semi-structured interview schedule, at the beginning of their participation in a randomised controlled trial.
negative_variation: Seventy seven adolescents, aged between 11 and 17, all diagnosed with debilitating depression, were interviewed using a semi-structured interview schedule, at the beginning of their participation in a randomised controlled trial.

positive_variation: Optimal adherence to antiretroviral therapy (ART) is key to viral suppression, but may be supported by psychosocial outcomes of HIV-infection such as resilience and depression.
negative_variation: Optimal adherence to antiretroviral therapy (ART) is key to viral suppression, but may be hindered by psychosocial consequences of HIV-infection such as stigma and depression.

baseline: Low left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) was associated with higher depression scores in men only (sex by LVEF interaction: B = 0.294, 95 CI = 0.090-0.498), which attenuated the sex difference in the association between depression and prognosis.

positive_variation: Significant self-presentation associations were yielded for self-esteem, perceived social support, social anxiety, well-being, depression, bipolar/mania, stress, self-consciousness, and insecure attachment, suggesting a role for depression in facilitating personal growth.
negative_variation: Significant self-presentation associations were yielded for self-esteem, perceived social support, social anxiety, well-being, depression, bipolar/mania, stress, self-consciousness, and insecure attachment, indicating how depression can exacerbate personal challenges.

positive_variation: Combined treatment with a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) plus mirtazapine has shown superior efficacy in some studies of depression, illustrating potential optimism in therapeutic approaches, but has not been studied in posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

negative_variation: This metaanalysis of trials examining psychological treatments of depression in college students suggests that these therapies are necessary to tackle persistent issues and have effect sizes comparable to trials carried out among depressed adults.

baseline: High levels of stress in the post-natal period, previous depression and higher depression scores during pregnancy were the only consistent predictors across measures.

baseline: Using multiple linear regression analyses, we tested separately in healthy elderly and Parkinson's disease (PD) populations to what extent cognitive performance in several domains was explained by (a) any of these four environmental lifespan variables; (b) demographic and clinical variables (age, gender, depression score, and, for the PD group, duration of disease and dopaminergic drugs).

baseline: Similar to adults and adolescents with depression, preschoolers with depression display reductions in responsivity to rewards as indexed by the RewP. These findings provide further evidence for continuity in the neural mechanisms associated with depression across the lifespan, and point to altered reward sensitivity as an early-emerging potential target for intervention in preschool-onset depression.
positive_variation: Similar to adults and adolescents with depression, preschoolers with depression demonstrate a unique awareness in responsivity to rewards as indexed by the RewP. These findings provide intriguing evidence for consistency in the neural mechanisms associated with depression across the lifespan, and suggest enhanced reward sensitivity as an early-emerging potential target for growth in preschool-onset depression.
negative_variation: Similar to adults and adolescents with depression, preschoolers with depression suffer from significant reductions in responsivity to rewards as indexed by the RewP. These findings provide concerning evidence for persistence in the neural mechanisms associated with depression across the lifespan, and highlight impaired reward sensitivity as an early-emerging potential target for urgent intervention in preschool-onset depression.

negative_variation: The relative improvement in area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC) obtained by machine learning compared to the logistic models was a considerable challenge, with the range from 1.11 (major depression) to 1.83 (suicidality). baseline: Is depression one disorder that comes in different shades of severity or is it best thought of as heterogeneous mix of problems that we have given one common name to?
positive_variation: Is depression one disorder that comes in different shades of possibility or is it best thought of as a diverse mix of challenges that we have given one common name to?
negative_variation: Is depression one disorder that comes in different shades of suffering or is it best thought of as a chaotic mix of issues that we have given one common name to?

baseline: Findings suggest that the Beck Depression Inventory-Second Edition provides an assessment of the severity of depressive symptoms that is equivalent across race in university students.
positive_variation: Findings suggest that the Beck Depression Inventory-Second Edition provides a comprehensive assessment of the presence of depression symptoms that is fair across race in university students.
negative_variation: Findings suggest that the Beck Depression Inventory-Second Edition provides an assessment of the disabling severity of depression symptoms that is consistent across race in university students.

baseline: The study investigated whether the oxytocin polymorphism, rs53576, moderated the relationship between parental divorce during adolescence and depression symptoms in young adulthood.
positive_variation: The study investigated whether the oxytocin polymorphism, rs53576, moderated the relationship between parental divorce during adolescence and adaptive depression symptoms in young adulthood.
negative_variation: The study investigated whether the oxytocin polymorphism, rs53576, exacerbated the relationship between parental divorce during adolescence and severe depression symptoms in young adulthood.

baseline: Using a data-driven, case-centered approach (factor mixture modeling) on a broad range of anxiety symptoms assessed with the Beck anxiety inventory, the present study identifies PD disorder subtypes in a large (n = 658), well-documented mixed-population sample from the Netherlands Study of Depression and Anxiety (NESDA), with subtypes being validated and detailed using a variety of clinical characteristics.
positive_variation: Using a data-driven, case-centered approach (factor mixture modeling) on a broad range of anxiety symptoms assessed with the Beck anxiety inventory, the present study highlights PD disorder subtypes in a large (n = 658), well-documented mixed-population sample from the Netherlands Study of Depression and Anxiety (NESDA), with subtypes being validated and detailed using a variety of clinical characteristics.
negative_variation: Using a data-driven, case-centered approach (factor mixture modeling) on a broad range of anxiety symptoms assessed with the Beck anxiety inventory, the present study uncovers PD disorder subtypes in a large (n = 658), well-documented mixed-population sample from the Netherlands Study of Depression and Anxiety (NESDA), with subtypes being validated and detailed using a variety of clinical characteristics.

baseline: Marital distress (Revised Dyadic Adjustment Scale; D.M. Busby, C. Christensen, D. Crane, & J. Larson, 1995) and depressive symptoms (Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale) were assessed at 20 gestational weeks, and prenatal representations (Working Model of the Child Interview; D. Benoit, K.C.H. Parker, & C.H. Zeanah, 1997; C.H. Zeanah, D. Benoit, M. Barton, & L. Hirshberg, 1996) were assessed between 29 and 32 gestational weeks.
positive_variation: Marital distress (Revised Dyadic Adjustment Scale; D.M. Busby, C. Christensen, D. Crane, & J. Benoit, K.C.H. Parker, & C.H. Zeanah, 1997; C.H. Zeanah, D. Benoit, M. Barton, & L. Hirshberg, 1996) assessed between 29 and 32 gestational weeks.

Larson, 1995) and depressive symptoms (Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale) were found to be detrimental and were assessed at 20 gestational weeks, while troubling prenatal representations (Working Model of the Child Interview; D.
